10027.description: The Boys and Girls Club of Harlem is committed to providing access and opportunities for youth to reach their full potential. General Support Volunteers help achieve that goal. The Boys and Girls Club serves members from 5-18 and increasing the adult to member count allows a more meaningful experience for members. Support volunteers allow us to run programs more effectively because there are more individuals to assist in facilitation. Key Responsibilities: Club Support volunteers will assist club staff as well as members to ensure a fun and safe environment for all. This role is to ensure our members are getting the most out of their club experience. Provide programmatic and operational support to the organization. This could be academic support, walking students to different programs and assisting staff with program facilitation.
10027.title: General Support Volunteer

10027.description: Sports Journalism Writer for Asphalt Green’s Community Sports Leagues Newsletter About Asphalt Green Asphalt Green is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to assisting individuals of all ages and backgrounds achieve health through a lifetime of sports and fitness. Our three main community programs reach over 33,000 New Yorkers and include: Waterproofing, which teaches elementary school children how to swim; Recess Enhancement Program, which sends a \"play coach\" to schools to get kids active during recess; and Community Sports League (CSL), which provides Harlem middle school students the chance to play interscholastic organized sports. Job Description As an integral member to the Community Sports League staff, you will be responsible for producing fun, highly detailed and engaging game write ups. You will write out the play by play, interview players, take action shots and choose your game MVP. Your submission will be included in the weekly newsletter and given out to all league participants. Location: Asphalt Green--555 East 90th Street Hours: Soccer, Saturdays 7:00pm - 9:00pm, Basketball Saturdays 10:00am-12:00pm Duration: January 2018 - June 2018 Duties: -Take notes on games every Saturday -Write a recap of each game in the style of a sports reporter. Who were the stars? Was it a close game? Was there a comeback? -Interview players, parents, coaches to add to your piece -Type up your notes and send to our newsletter coordinator by Tuesday morning -Provide general assistance to AG’s CSL staff in maintaining order and a safe, positive environment Qualifications -Excellent writing skills -Must be able to meet deadlines and respond to emails quickly -Must be creative, outgoing and able to speak with kids in a relatable way in order to get fun and full stories -Background in Sports, Communications, or other related discipline is a plus
10027.title: Sports Journalism Writer for Asphalt Green Community Sports Leagues Newsletter

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring once a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 1-3 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 25% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Volunteer Duties: Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 1-3 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteer Requirements: Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 4 pm to 5:30 pm beginning July 9th, 2018, through August 18th, 2018 Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Help students in grades 1-3 boost their literacy skills during the summer!

Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 4-6 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 25% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! 10455.title: Help students in grades 4-6 boost their literacy skills during the summer!

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our six-week Summer STEM program in which Masa scholars hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus on the local community. The Summer STEM Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx) When: The Summer STEM Program will begin on July 9th, 2018 and will end on August 16th, 2018 Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm (volunteers are asked to commit to at least one consistent day per week) What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12) Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits) Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring once a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 4-6 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 25% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Volunteer Duties: Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteer Requirements: Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 9th, 2018, through August 18th, 2018 Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Help students in grades 4-6 boost their literacy skills during the summer!

10455.description: Girl Vow, Inc is seeking volunteer women mentors who can conduct various gender-focused workshops or who are interested in mentoring a girl for an academic year. You must live in the NYC area. Please send an updated resume to the email address girlvow@gmail.com.
10455.title: Mentor Girls in the Foster Care & Juvenile Justice Systems

10455.description: We are seeking dedicated volunteers to provide tutoring and homework help to elementary and middle school students at our South Bronx community center. Masa's After-school Program operates on weekday evenings ( Mondays-Thursdays) from 6 PM-8PM. At the program, students primarily receive homework help, grow as readers, and learn how to set goals and achieve them. Masa's 2016-2017 After-School Program (MAP) will start on September 18, 2017 and run through May 24, 2018. Volunteers are admitted on a rolling basis. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer consistently for at least one of the following days: Monday (6 PM - 8 PM); Tuesday (6 PM - 8 PM); Wednesday (6 PM - 8 PM); or Thursday (6 PM - 8 PM). Able to commit to volunteering for all or most of the 2017-2018 academic year (college students who will leave NYC in May are still eligible to volunteer). W hen working with children, consistency is the key to success! Willingness and ability to serve as a tutor/homework facilitator to elementary or middle school students in an individual or small group setting. Attend mandatory Masa trainings and events (provided advance notice and multiple options for scheduling). Committed to following all Masa policies and procedures, including with respect to confidentiality Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff For more information, fill out our interest form at www.masany.org/volapp/ or contact volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: A love for education grows in the Bronx! Tutor students 2 hours/week.

07042.description: Celebrate the Summer Solstice and VOLUNTEER! Each year on or near June 21, United Ways across the country organize a community-wide day of service called United Way Day of Action. With more daylight hours than any other, the summer solstice is the ideal day to let your actions speak louder than words. It’s the perfect way to show what it means to LIVE UNITED. By hosting a nationwide volunteer day, United Way fulfills its mission by mobilizing the caring power of thousands of people in each community Take Action for ALICE (r) United Way of Northern New Jersey is focusing our 2018 Day of Action efforts on helping local ALICE ( Asset Limited, Income Constrained, Employed) families and their children in our region. Do you know ALICE? You likely interact with many ALICE individuals every day - community members who are working hard, but still struggling to afford the basics. In our region, 26 percent of residents are ALICE or living in poverty. United Way Day of Action is the perfect way to show your support for these community members. Join us to help children from ALICE families this summer to: 1) maintain their reading and literacy skills with new books and activities; 2) maintain their food security through access to healthy food items and snacks; and 3) learn how ALICE families struggle to make ends meet in our community. Volunteers will assemble \"ALICE Healthy Food Action Kits\" and \"ALICE Literacy Action Kits\" for preschoolers and elementary school students. The kits will include: books, bookmark, pencil, related activity and reading guide for parents (literacy); an assortment of healthy snacks and easy-access meals, activity to promote healthy eating and water bottle (health). Volunteers will then help to distribute the kits to ALICE children at local nonprofit partners in the community. For corporate groups looking to participate, we suggest a donation of $25 per volunteer. Sign up today - volunteer slots are limited!
07042.title: Day of Action 2018 - Take Action for ALICE Kids this Summer (Montclair)
07042.org: United Way of Northern New Jersey

06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. Advocacy experience is also highly regarded. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide - including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, members, collaborating organizations and legislators as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Excellent written and verbal skills are a must. 11801.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Friday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11801.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Broadway Multiplex in Hicksville, NY!

10044.description: Purpose: This role supports the New York City Be The Match Walk+Run Local Organizing Committee. The mission of the Local Organizing Committee (LOC) is to provide local support in the fundraising and promotion of the Be The Match Walk+Run event. It is important for each market to have a strong LOC to help broaden the reach of the event. This internship provides the opportunity to experience first-hand the many facets of operating a fundraising event following a national template within the New York City market. Location: Home-based, New York City Key Responsibilities: * Assist with Walk+Run event operations including: data entry, list development, LOC meetings, and other efforts based on the direction provided by the Development Manager. * Communicate with past/former Walk+Run team captains to encourage their team’s participation and fundraising for the 2018 event. * Recruit new participant teams for the 2018 event and encourage team fundraising utilizing Be The Match Walk+Run participant team fundraising tools. * Assist with the event sponsorship program, primarily through ensuring the fulfillment of sponsorship benefits: acknowledging gifts, updating websites and collateral with sponsor logos, providing information to sponsors for their own internal company campaigns. * Research potential sponsors and in-kind donations by soliciting area businesses via email, telephone, and in person. * Act as Secretary for all LOC meetings and send out meeting notes to all members within 2-3 business days. (LOC meetings typically occur evenings and weekends.) * Assist with coordinating the Walk+Run Kick-off community engagement event. * May fulfill an LOC Chair role in the absence of another volunteer. Reports to: Development Manager, Liz Neihart Time Commitment: * May 2018 - October 2018 * Must volunteer a minimum of 120 hours * Flexible working hours, with some evening and weekend commitments Compensation: Unpaid Qualifications and Requirements: * Must be enrolled at an institution of higher learning. There is a 6-month grace period post-graduation. The internship can be for class credit, but that is not required. * Must be willing to work from a home-based office environment connecting remotely with supervisor. * Able to travel locally within the city to meet sponsors, volunteers, and staff. * Self-motivated, strong interest in nonprofit work and belief in community service, strong interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to work independently and as a member of a team. * Lifting boxes and supplies may be required as part of preparing for event and promotional opportunities. Benefits Provided: Receive an orientation and work under the direction of the Development Manager. Develop time management, writing and communication, leadership, and project management skills. Gain knowledge of fundraising and event logistics. Organization Description: The National Marrow Donor Program (NMDP) and Be The Match (BTM) is the global leader in providing marrow, PBSC, and umbilical cord blood transplants to patients with leukemia, lymphoma, and other diseases. The nonprofit organization matches patients with donors, educates health care professionals, supports patients and their families, and conducts research so more lives can be saved. Be The Match Walk+Run Overview: Be The Match Walk+Run is a fundraising event that helps patients with blood cancers like leukemia find a marrow donor and receive a life-saving transplant. Every four minutes someone is diagnosed with a blood cancer. It can happen to anyone at any time. But so can a cure - a marrow transplant. The cure for blood cancer is in the hands of ordinary people. Most of us won’t have a marrow donor in our family and Be The Match matches volunteer marrow donors with patients who need them. The Be The Match Walk+Run (5K, 1K, and Tot Trot) raises funds to: add more volunteer potential marrow donors to the Be The Match Registry, giving more patients hope for a cure; help patients with uninsured treatment costs; and support continued marrow transplant research.
10044.title: Be The Match Walk+Run Service Intern: New York City

11201.description: The objective of the \"Kids Supporting Kids\" program is for these students to be able to express their own artistic and creative side in a group setting as a way to engage in an authentic dialog around their life-altering experience due to cancer. The program focuses on building self-esteem, barrier breaking and education of children affected by cancer, their siblings, classmates and schoolmates. The overarching goal of this program is to increase awareness and sensitize students about the effects of this life-threatening disease on children. We believe that introducing an open conversation about the implications of cancer and its struggle will prove to be a stepping-stone towards achieving a more harmonious and understanding atmosphere for all the students. +Reach out to schools whether through emails, phone calls, social media, in person, etc. +Be comfortable around children, families, and adults to have a conversation with them and get them excited about the program! +Have 5-10 hours per week available to research, email, make phone calls, and create incredible event ideas for the schools. +Creating documents and implementing other volunteers to partake in the events. + Understanding of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Drive. +Be organized, professional, on time, and have the understand this is a volunteer opportunity and taking every opportunity you may have as your last. + Be comfortable with reaching out to vendors, schools, teachers, etc. to make the events happen. +Be able to work independently and in a group setting but also be able to be self motivated to do the work. +Support AFB Mission

11201.description: A Free Bird is launching a new program \"AFB Support Group\" which is designed to provide emotional support for the families of the children through the arts. Just like we empower the children of A Free Bird to fight their disease through the arts, we want to empower the family to feel the love and support of one another through all types of art mediums. Since 2008, we have seen how receiving a cancer diagnosis can put a great amount of pain and stress on a family's emotional well being. Though the children are working with art tutors, the parents and children are missing their own form of art therapy. +Giving them the skills to empower them and to use in their everyday life so when they speak to their children they are good and well and can use the skills they used to speak and do not have to unload on others- these parents dont have time of their own so to properly sit down w their kids using movement skills Acquire skills that lead to a healthier lifestyle for individuals and when speaking to children +Finding health and wellness teachers +Must have 3 month availability +Must be able to work on their own and be able to attend the events created +Assist and work with setting up for the event if need be. +Be comfortable with phone calls, emails, and speaking to people in person +Be comfortable speaking with speaking to the parents of the children

11201.description: ***Serious inquiries only, please only respond with a resume and an interest of 6 months or more, anyone who does not meet the following requirements will not be accepted for this volunteer opportunity.*** A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life-threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans, and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theater, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success.To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net-worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply: please send your CV along with a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11201.title: Volunteer Director of Development

11201.description: Volunteers will assist teachers in the classroom, by helping students grasp a deeper understanding of the classroom materials through one-on-one tutoring. In addition to tutoring during class hours, tutors will also work on additional study materials with students outside of class hours. Tutors will attend a 30-45 minutes orientation to learn about CASES and their volunteer position. Tutoring dates and times: Monday - Thursday 10:30 AM - 5:30 PM If you share a passion for working with youth, and a strong interest in volunteerism, this opportunity is for you.
11201.title: Tutor Volunteer
11201.org: CENTER FOR ALTERNATIVE SENTENCING AND EMPLOYMENT SERVICES INC

11201.description: Volunteers will meet with program participants (mentees) to develop supportive relationships. Mentors will assist mentees in solving school related, personal relationship, and career related problems that may interfere with learning and day-to-day living. If you value ongoing growth, share a passion for working with youth, and a strong interest in volunteerism, we strongly welcome you to share your knowledge, and expertise with our participants as a mentor. Mentoring Days and Times: Monday - Thrusday 10:30 AM - 5:30 PM
11201.title: Mentor Volunteer
11201.org: CENTER FOR ALTERNATIVE SENTENCING AND EMPLOYMENT SERVICES INC

11202.description: Looking for a fun summer internship? We offer a hands on opportunity for interns to work on our website, brochures, flyers, etc. Great experience, meet new people, casual atmosphere and great career builder. Assist with all aspects of creating promotional materials. Visit our website for more information about the Toy Museum, www.ToyMuseumNY.org. Email your resume along with a link to projects you have created.
11202.title: Graphic Design Summer Interns

11205.description: Calling All Park Enthusiasts: Become a Volunteer Greeter at Fort Greene Park! Engage and educate park patrons on park events, history and more by joining our new Volunteer Greeter program. Apply here: https://goo.gl/forms/Is2dpgimhyIBsjG53 For questions, email: ccortes@fortgreenepark.org
11205.title: Volunteer Greeters

11205.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. We are seeking a Marketing Intern who can commit 5-10 hours per week for minimum of 3 months (50 hours). Position is non-paid but can apply for school internship credit. This is not a filing and get coffee type internship. You will have REAL responsibilities and acquire marketable experience Responsibilities: Assist with daily project management of digital and traditional marketing, working with Marketing Coordinator on strategy, analytics and logistics Coordinate the working document to track projects cross-departmentally Assist in Managing timelines for e-appeals, campaigns, cultivations and optimizations (such as donor pages, homepage and confirmations); Assist with Managing timelines for vetting of direct mail pieces for six different appeals monthly; Assist with coordinating the Integrated Marketing Calendar of all fundraising and cultivation activities; Liaison with the Programs, Graphic Design/Web, Fundraising and PR departments Draft marketing copy for brochures, posters, presentations and other organizational collateral; Coordinate with the Graphic Design and Web department with copy for creative projects; Performing other responsibilities as may be required. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11205.title: Marketing Volunteer

11205.description: We are looking for volunteers that like working with children and would like to improved their tennis skills. Volunteers will be ask to attend a one day free training and must become a member of USTA. Once you are a member you will take a On line training course and you must pass a back ground screening. We will offer all volunteers free racquet stringing and at least one free private lesson.
11205.title: Youth Tennis Program at Fort Greene Park

11205.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. We have launched a magazine to promote, communicate and support our organization's mission. Our premiere issue launched 9/23/13 and we are actively developing our next edition. We are seeking a talented editor with excellent time-management, team leadership and project management skills to perform a variety of editorial tasks, such as writing, editing, and copyediting, as well as supervising staff and keeping the magazine on schedule. Recent graduates or graduate students who held editor-positions with their school newspapers, school year books, or other school periodicals are strongly encouraged to apply. Non-Traditional/Continuing Education students strongly encouraged to apply Please review our premier edition at http://www.afreebird.org/magazine/ All applicants should anticipate a 1 month, with rigorous work between January 19th-February 5th.
11205.title: Magazine Editor

11206.description: SATURDAY June 23rd, 2017 NYSoM PRESENTS SUPERHERO SCI-FI FESTIVAL IN BROOKLYN FEATURING DC/MARVEL SUPERHERO ACTIVITIES, STAR WARS/STAR TREK SCI FI ACTIVITIES, CARNIVAL STYLE GAMES & MORE NYSoM needs volunteers to: Be a Superhero for a day (NYSoM provides the costume, YOU provide the hero) Setup administer and breakdown the event Manage the carnival games and superhero trivia/activities & other NYSoM Activities HOW TO APPLY volunteering@nysomgroup.org or nysomvolunteering@gmail.com
11206.title: 6/23: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED- NYSoM SUPERHERO SCI FI FESTIVAL IN BROOKLYN

11206.description: Mentoring Kids Through Tennis Kings County Tennis League (KCTL) is a registered 501c3 non-profit that uses tennis as an instrument for mentorship and community building in Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. We literally bring tennis to the children’s communities. KCTL is seeking enthusiastic individuals who are comfortable working with kids and ready to develop their roles as mentors.Tennis skills are helpful, but not required. For the summer season, our free classes are Saturday mornings, June 2 through September 22, at the following sites in Bedford Stuyvesant, BK: Lafayette Gardens, Marcy, Sumner, Tompkins and Jackie Robinson. Volunteers must commit to a minimum number of classes. Duties for each class included: tossing tennis balls, giving out high fives, directing and communicating with students, and teaching If you have a tennis background. Basically, however, you will serve as a positive role model that the kids look forward to seeing each day. All volunteers are required to undergo a background check and training. Volunteers will receive a KCTL team jersey and invites to special volunteer events as a thanks for all their hard work. Please fill out a KCTL registration form if you’re interested, or contact rob@kingscountytennisleague.org.
11206.title: Mentor Kids through After-School Tennis

11206.description: DSPAC is seeking eager volunteers to assist with planning our 4th annual Seeds of Possibility Gala on November 8th.
11206.title: Gala Planning Committee
11206.org: DWANA SMALLWOOD PERFORMING ARTS CENTER INC

11206.description: A progressive, public elementary school with a Spanish dual language program. Our project-based, integrated curriculum focuses on STEAM (science, technology, engineering, ARTS & math) with language immersion. We believe that children learn best when they engage in hands-on and playful experiences that are as authentic as possible. Brighter Choice Community School needs an interior designer to help transform a classroom into a teachers' lounge. We're looking for resourceful people with a vision and who can work on a small budget.
11206.title: New Teachers' Lounge

11208.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11208.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Linden Blvd Multiplex in Brooklyn, NY!

11225.description: This program is for teens and college students looking for a seasonal volunteer opportunity. Based in the Prospect Park Zoo's Education Department, Discovery Guides are seasonal volunteers (14 - 22) who receive training in customer service and basic interpretation. Discovery Guides focus on a select group of visitor experiences and, in turn, gain experience with teaching, leadership, public speaking, and learn about animals and the wild places they inhabit! Discovery Guides will: Interact with children, families, and general visitors at select exhibits and educational activities around the zoo Help out with zoo birthday parties on weekends Interact with children in the Discovery Center and at our Nature Playscape Participate in the Wildlife Conservation Society's Conservation Action campaigns We are currently recruiting youth for Summer 2018. Training will be June 10, 17, 24, 28 & 29. Volunteers must commit to two full days per week for the summer season. Applications will be available on our website in March, and are due by May 1, 2018. To request an application sooner, email the Volunteer Coordinator at ppzvolunteer@wcs.org.
11225.title: Summer Discovery Guide

11225.description: We are a 501 (C) 3 non profit organization dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the arts. A Free Bird will be hosting it's 3rd Annual Gala on November 16th and we are in need of volunteer photographers and videographers. You will receive credit for photos/videos used as well as a special mention in our brochure. We are seeking people who have done photographer/videography before at big events and know how to create incredible stills. We ask a few photographers/videographers show up when we do for setup at 11:00am. The event ends at 9:00pm so the latest we would need you is until 9:30/10:00pm. For clean up and sometimes the events goes over a bit, other photos might need to be taken as individuals are leaving.
11225.title: Photographer/Videographer Volunteer

11368.description: \"BLOOM\" This is a 13 week temporary volunteer position, helping coordinate the teaching of simple arts (pencil illustration, water painting, etc.) to approximately 15 adults, ranging in age starting at 60yr, at a local Corona, Queens senior center. This class meets every Thursday 1pm-3pm, starting the week of April 1st and ending the week of June 25th. All art supplies are provided. Photos are taken of activities. An exhibit displaying participants' works will be promoted at the end of the program. Requirements: artist experience, patience, reliability, previous teaching to youth or adults.
11368.title: TEACHING ARTIST - teaching art to senior community
11368.org: The Arts at Henson-Parks, Inc. / TAHP Roots

11362.description: Help us out at our dance party for A Time For Us About the program: A Time for Us allows adults with Developmental Disabilities, ages 21-40, to participate in social and recreational opportunities in a safe and nurturing environment. Participants will have the opportunity to make lasting friendships while taking part in fun activities with peers and caring and professional staff and community members. We are in serious need of volunteers to help socialize with those in attendance. We also need help decorating the space.
11362.title: Help Adults with Developmental Disabilities End Of The Year Party!
11362.org: Samuel Field Y / Central Queens Y

11222.description: We'll be picking up excess catered food from a Greenpoint office and delivering it to Northside Senior Center in Williamsburg, located at 179 N 6th St. Join us! This event will last 30 minutes. Lightweight: the average amount of food rescued from this pickup is 10-20 pounds.
11222.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Fridays 2:30PM!

07931.description: The Arc Foundation of Somerset County is seeking an intern for 3 to 4 hours a week who is interested in learning the day to day tasks within the fundraising and marketing arm of The Arc Foundation of Somerset County. Duties include: Learning/Working with a donor application program for entries and reporting Learning/Working with the creation and design of new/revised agency department brochures and website content Learning/Working and supporting the planning, organizing, and day to day functions that lead up to a Golf Fundraising Event on September 17, 2018 (new event) and Arc Angel Gala on November 2, 2018. This includes ongoing marketing, sponsorship solicitation, community outreach, social media marketing, recruiting, and all on-site day of event operations. Learning/Working on the Camp Jotoni Capital Campaign including assisting with outreach and marketing Website content and social media development for \"The Achievement Center\" at Raritan Valley Community College The hours needed for this internship will vary based on the individual's schedule, however, we are looking for a total of 3-4 hours per week Monday-Friday during business hours.
07931.title: Marketing/Event Planning/Fundraising Intern Wanted

06830.description: Marketing volunteers will join our marketing committee. Marketing seeks to generate Foundation of Hope (FoH) interest and to develop strategies that encourage involvement and investment in FoH's mission. Marketing handle public relations, website, social media communications, newsletters, annual report and other marketing projects. Identify and recruit community leaders to serve with Board members. They also engage in advocacy, campaigning and networking. Marketing volunteers will develop communications with media and press. Requirements: Attend 1 hour monthly meeting in person or via conference call Volunteer 2 hours per week Social media knowledge Proof-reading ability Ability to work independently or as part of a team Press releases Branding Knowledge graphic design Knowlege of branding
06830.title: Marketing

10601.description: Tell the world you believe Mental Health Matters. Volunteer for Get On Your Mat For Mental Health , an outdoor mega-yoga event, on Wednesday, June 20th at Court Street (between Main St. and Martine Ave.) in White Plains, NY. 10020.description: As an Office Support Assistant, you have the opportunity to support the administrative functions of our agency in various capacities and settings. Duties include, but are not limited to : filing, copying, creating and maintaining data, program specific projects, and managing telephone lines. Office Support Assistants are needed in all five boroughs! This role is ideal for someone who has: · Clerical skills · Typing skills · Experience with Microsoft Word · Customer Service experience (preferable) Time commitment and hours are flexible. 10020.title: Office Support Assistant

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike! 6/22/18

10701.description: Volunteers should expect to work with several children during each 2 hour session. The children will have selected a book and then be matched up with a volunteer. After introductions the \"buddies\" will find a spot where they can work together for 20 minutes. The volunteer will encourage the student to read, help with specific words, pronunciation and comprehension. When they’ve finished the book the volunteer will help the child complete a worksheet. We give out \"passports\" to every child who registers for Summer Reading Buddies and each child gets a stamp on his passport for each day they attend. The volunteer will then bring the child back to our staff who will match them up with their next \"buddy\". Summer Reading Buddies volunteer opportunties are also available at the Ossining Public Library. Please contact us for further information. Everyone enjoys this program. Take a look at coverage by WPIX 11: http://www.jcy-wcp.com/summermediacraze.html
10701.title: Summer Reading Buddies

10701.description: Mentor wil develop supportive, consistent mentoring relationship with a child through recreational play and paraprofessional therapeutic techniques. Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor

11212.description: Breaking Ground is NYC’s largest provider of supportive housing and street outreach for the city’s homeless population. Including both transitional and permanent supportive housing, we now have 23 buildings across the city dedicated to serving the street homeless and those in danger of becoming so. Beyond providing folks with four walls and a roof, we strive to be a support system as well for the people we serve with the many services and resources we provide. Once indoors, many of our clients are able to reclaim their lives and dignity, and we help them on their path to resocialization with the help of volunteers though our community-building events. These events typically include BBQs, art shows, health fairs and large dinners, where volunteers come to help facilitate the events, but more importantly, they engage with our residents, creating a more welcoming space for them to come home to. The event is called the Brownsville Barbecue, and its purpose is to build community within our walls, while encouraging our residents to engage with the broader, surrounding community as well. Here are the event details: Hegeman Barbecue 39 Hegeman Avenue Brooklyn, NY 11212 Friday, June 15, 2018 3:00 - 7:00pm We are looking for 10-15 volunteers to help facilitate this event by decorating the event space, working the grill, serving food and refreshments, taking photographs, and most importantly, engaging with our residents and creating a warm and inviting living space for them. If this opportunity interests you, please email Erin Williams at volunteer@breakingground.org.
11212.title: Brownsville BBQ

11212.description: Do you believe every child and family deserve the right to buy and eat fresh produce and healthy food at affordable prices? Are you into food justice and do you believe healthy eating is a civil right? Then, work with students, parents, educators and the community to build school-run Hip2B Healthy Market/Farmstand/Fleas in Brownsville, Brooklyn and in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Both these neighborhoods are ranked among NYC's most food-insecure zones, by the NYC Health Dept. and multiple studies. There is limited access to fruits and vegetables and overwhelming junk food options. These neighborhoods have among the highest obesity, diabetes, heart disease rates in the city - mainly due to lack of access to affordable fresh produce and healthy activities. Be the change! Seeking volunteers on these days! Choose any: In school, working with elementary and/or middle school students (btw 8 am and 3 pm, hours optional) - Tuesdays am - Help prep market in Flatbush (hours flexible) - - Wednesday am - Help run market - 7 -10 am (and offer any special cooking, recipes, etc.) - Thursdays - any time all day in Brownsville (help prep for market and cook with kids) - Friday am (Brownsville) - 7-10 am - Help run market and other activities - Saturdays, 9-3 pm (Brownsville) - Help run market and do activities with kids and families, including yoga, fitness like zumba, art, tutor, cook healthy recipes, etc. Do you garden? Do you want to help children grow food as well? Let us know. Looking for anyone who wants to work with students and families and educators and the local commuity to effect sustainable change by building local capacity. All talents and skills welcome - even an hour-long yoga class. Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Want to join a new flea? Have a home business and want to get more exposure? Join us. WE LAUNCH BROWNSVILLE ON FEB. 3 AND FLATBUSH ON MARCH 7. Saturday Market: Set-up: 9-10 am Activities: 10 am - 2 pm Breakdown: 2-3 pm School days - we arrange with you. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Do you want to lead a healthy workshop - even with friends? A cooking demo or a dance class? In health profession? Can you do blood pressure screenings, offer nutrition or diabetes education or more? Anything more? Please join us. Parents are asking! You can also offer any kind of physical activity - dance, zumba, soccer, yoga - just for an hour in the gym. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? Email - info@seedsinthemiddle.org
11212.title: Food! Health! Help Brownsville, Flatbush BK kids launch healthy market days!

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to build a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! We need players to coach kids ages 3 and up and help lead teams. Most children have never played soccer and some come back every season - so there's a variety of levels. This is a neighborhood with limited healthy options - to eat or get physically fit. So, you'll play a role in not only building teamwork, but empowering youth and families to get active. Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program starting now through end of summer. Weekends - Saturdays and Sundays. Thursday evenings also possible. Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Attn, Students! Yes, we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to expand a nascent league. . Kids love it, but don't know the game so we need your help. We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. Can you play in a fundraising opening soccer game? We can schedule in March! SCHEDULE - April 21 - June 23 APRIL 21 - JUNE 23 SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 12 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If we have enough players, will create boys and girls only teams for ages 10 and up.. If you're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your background so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org If you have other times you are available - even to do a workshop in a school, let us know. YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - facebook.com/seedsinthemiddle https://www.facebook.com/brooklyncrown.heightssoccer https://www.facebook.com/Soccer-for-Harmony-204551942961230/ Instagram: @seedsinthemiddle
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for Brooklyn  kids!

11210.description: Chefs! Join our Hip2B Healthy Movement and lead a Chef Night with students at public schools. Only 4-hour commitment on a weekday night. Particularly looking for May 9, May 20 or May 22 Challenge: Prepare with youth a nutritious, delicious meal for the same cost as a fast food combo! What you do: Before - prepare recipes (buy food and we reimburse or we supply) Day of: Come to school at 3:30 or 4 pm, work in school kitchen with the number of youth you choose from 4th grade-8th grade, and prepare a full meal - protein, vegetable, and whatever else to show parents they can cook healthy and cheaper than fast food. - Prepare with faculty and youth take-home bags with recipes... 6 pm - Make brief presentation to parents who come to eat ... about how you cooked, healthy cooking tips Everyone then eats and we clean up and are done by 8 pm YOU CAN BE A CULINARY STUDENT - OR GROUP - OR NUTRITIONIST - IDEA IS TO GIVE TOOLS IN A JOYFUL, FUN EVENING TO COOK AND EAT HEALTHY AFFORDABLY Questions: email info@seedsinthemiddle.org Locations: Flatbush, Brooklyn schools and maybe others in Crown Heights, or Brownsville...
11210.title: Chefs! Cook healthy with kids at Chef Night at NYC school

11210.description: Join a dynamic new Hip2B Healthy School initiative in Flatbush! We are running a market on Wednesdays at 7:30 to 8 am and we also have teachers who want to expand the garden after school 2:30-4:30 pm on Wednesdays. We plan to expand to other days on these activities. If you love to garden and can help - or just want to be part of a movement in which you are an active participant in food justice - working with students and teachers to create access to fresh fruits and vegetables and healthy options, this is for you. We accept all offers of volunteerism on any day. We want partners also to help us meet with students to organize our market so we can expand to a real farmers market. Right now, students and teachers serve fresh orange juice and fresh juices at the morning market. We plan to expand hours - hopefully to afterschool - and also offerings - parfaits, smoothies, icies, and more... Can you help us build? Please send us an email at info@seedsinthemiddle.org and tell us what you can do and what hours you are available. Students can also meet during their lunch hour : 11:15- 12 noon Flatbush is one of the e neighborhoods ranked among NYC's most food-insecure zones, by the NYC Health Dept. and multiple studies. There is limited access to fruits and vegetables and overwhelming junk food options. These neighborhoods have among the highest obesity, diabetes, heart disease rates in the city - mainly due to lack of access to affordable fresh produce and healthy activities. Be the change! We also plan to hold an all-day Saturday market in June - so you can also volunteer for that. But again - we take all offers! HELP TEACHERS AND STUDENTS BUILD THEIR GARDEN HELP STUDENTS IN THEIR HIP2B HEALTHY MARKET and help us expand to a full farmers market - run by students! We give community service credits. A little more detail below - FYI - if you are a chef or love to cook and want to share healthy eating, help us host Chef Nights at schools... Obligation - Weekday night 4-8 pm Looking for anyone who wants to work with students and families and educators and the local commuity to effect sustainable change by building local capacity. All talents and skills welcome - even an hour-long yoga class. Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? Email - info@seedsinthemiddle.org
11210.title: Garden! Help run healthy market with kids at Flatbush school -  Be the change!

11216.description: This is an opportunity to be a part of a cultural festival in the Bed-Stuy community, celebrating African-American history and culture. Some volunteers will be part of our stage crew, loading and unloading and also making sure everything is in place for performers. Other volunteers will help with communication between the various areas where activities are taking place. Others will assist our Tech people. Please note that we are also looking for health professionals to volunteer their services in the form of health screenings and/ or information. Whether you prefer to work behind the scenes or interact with the public, there is a place for you! This is a great chance to help put on an amazing festival!
11216.title: Help with a Juneteenth festival celebrating African-American history and culture!

11216.description: This event is a health and wellness fair which is part of the cultural celebration for Juneteenth. Also known as Juneteenth Independence Day or Freedom Day, it is an American holiday that commemorates the June 19, 1865, announcement of the abolition of slavery, and more generally the emancipation of enslaved African-Americans throughout the former Confederacy of the southern United States. For our part, we will have an outside area in the plaza which will have health and wellness professionals providing workshops, information and events to the community gathered for the celebration. Our volunteers will be filling in a variety of roles from registering attendees upon arrival into the plaza, to participating in some of the live demos on our stage, to helping tweet, blog, and update live feeds with happenings from the day. Come be a part of an event that will make a difference in a community! For those still requiring community service hours we are happy to provide service hour letters. If you require something specific please let us know and we will do our best to accommodate.
11216.title: Come participate and gain some cultural knowledge

11216.description: Calling all RUNNERS... interested in entering the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon but were not chosen in the lottery? You still can! Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC), a nonprofit that embraces and empowers children of incarcerated parents, has slots for marathon runners on our 10-person team. To learn more about the benefits of running with Team CPNYC, which includes guaranteed entry into the race, please visit: https://www.cpnyc.org/marathon Run for a reason and raise awareness for a population of children who have an incarcerated parent! ABOUT CPNYC CPNYC is a community-based organization in Brooklyn working to ensure children left behind by prisoners are empowered to break the cycle of intergenerational incarceration and imagine futures bigger and brighter than their current circumstances. All funds raised will go directly toward program support and much needed therapeutic supplies and interventions.
11216.title: Run the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon!

11217.description: June 12 th,9:30am-3:00pm or any part of the day Help with registration, engage the children and help in all valuable ways at The Jewish Board’s Annual Domestic Violence Health Fair. Featuring: Survivor Stories, Discussion of DV as a health issue, Networking. Refreshments will be served.
11217.title: The Jewish Board’s Annual Domestic Violence Health Fair
11217.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

11217.description: Operation Manager Assistant About The Company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Operations Manager Assistant to join our organization for the long term. As an Operations Manager Assistant you will work closely with the Operations Manager to meet A free Bird Organization’s organizational goals. Responsibilities Assist Operations Manager in supervising daily operations of organization. Develop productive, profitable and achievement oriented working environment for employees. Address operational issues and concerns in a timely fashion. Supervise operations team to ensure operational excellence and excellent customer services. Educate operations team on best practices, company policies and service excellence standards. Develop and maintain operational guidelines for staffs. Assist in interviewing, recruiting, training, performance evaluation, promotion Determine staffing requirements, work assignment and schedules for new projects. Coordinate with General Manager in different operational issues and promotional activities. Evaluate current operational strategies and recommend improvements. Generate operational reports for management. Competencies Leadership Conflict Management Business Negotiation Decision-Making People Management Data Entry Skills Data Processing Skills Deadline-Oriented Budget Development Critical Thinking and Problem Solving Skills Planning and Organizing Communication Skills Persuasiveness Influencing and Leading Delegation Team Work Adaptability Stress Tolerance
11217.title: Director of Finance
