11217.description: Operations Manager About the company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Operations Manager to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Responsibilities Recruit, select, train, assign, schedule, coach, counsel volunteers Communicate job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising and reviewing job contributions Plan and review compensation actions; enforcing policies and procedures Contribute operations information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; prepare and complete action plans;; resolve problems; Forecast requirements; prepare an annual budget; schedule expenditures; initiating corrective actions Analyze process workflow, volunteer and space requirements and equipment layout; implement changes Maintain safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations Accomplish operations and organization mission by completing related results as needed Responsible for all department managers and supervisors, with review/approval responsibility for all operations employees Run a safe, injury/accident free workplace Establish contracts and pricing and ensuring proper maintenance and serving as primary liaison with utilities and local government agencies, such as fire, police, health and safety agencies Review and approve all operational invoices and ensure they are submitted for payment Serve as primary point of contact Communicate customer issues with operations team and devise ways of improving the customer experience, including resolving problems and complaints Work closely with GM and management team to set and/or implement policies, procedures and systems and to follow through with implementation. Communicate all operating policies and/or issues at department meetings. Competencies Leadership Conflict Management Business Negotiation Decision-Making People Management Data Entry Skills Data Processing Skills Deadline-Oriented Budget Development Critical Thinking and Problem Solving Skills Planning and Organizing Communication Skills Persuasiveness Influencing and Leading Delegation Team Work
11217.title: Operations Manager Volunteer

11217.description: Development Director About the Company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and held accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply : please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return.
11217.title: Development Director Volunteer

11217.description: Executive Director About the Company AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office in Israel, among others. Job Purpose We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Executive Director to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. As an Executive director of A free Bird Organization you are the key management leader focusing on overseeing the administration, programs and strategic plan of the organization. Responsibilities Work closely with board in order to fulfill the organization mission Communicate effectively with the Board and providing, in a timely and accurate manner, all information necessary for the Board to function properly and to make informed decisions. Develop resources sufficient to ensure the financial health of the organization. Oversee and implement appropriate resources to ensure that the operations of the organization are appropriate. Engage in signing all notes, agreements, and other instruments made and entered into and on behalf of the organization. Establishing employment and administrative policies and procedures for all functions and for the day-to-day operation of the nonprofit. Report to and work closely with the Board of Directors to seek their involvement in policy decisions, fundraising and to increase the overall visibility of the Foundation throughout the State. Supervise, collaborate with organization staff. Strategic planning and implementation. Oversee organization Board and committee meetings. Oversee marketing and other communications efforts. Review and approve contracts for services. Other duties as assigned by the Board of Directors. Competencies A bachelor’s degree Transparent and high integrity leadership Five or more years senior nonprofit management experience Solid, hands-on, budget management skills, including budget preparation, analysis, decision-making and reporting Strong organizational abilities including planning, delegating, program development and task facilitation Ability to convey a vision of A Free Bird’s strategic future to staff, board, volunteers and donors Knowledge of fundraising strategies and donor relations unique to nonprofit sector Skills to collaborate with and motivate board members and other volunteers Strong written and oral communication skills Ability to interface and engage diverse volunteer and donor groups Demonstrated ability to oversee and collaborate with staff Strong public speaking ability
11217.title: Executive Director Volunteer

11217.description: We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. The Board seeks a part-time, Digital Marketing Intern to join our organization. As a digital Marketing Intern you will focus on planning and directing marketing strategies for our online audience. Bachelor degree in Marketing, advertising, communication and related fields Knowledgeable of marketing and advertising principles Experience in digital media planning In-depth knowledge of search engine optimization best-practices Hands-on social media strategy and community management experience Excellent presentation skills and comfortable speaking in project meetings Ability to maintain job performance and a positive attitude
11217.title: Digital Marketing Volunteer

11217.description: We are currently seeking 1-2 people to help us out with the following for our Parents support group of children being affected by cancer: 1. Assist with securing new Support Group sponsors 2. Communicate with vendors to secure deliverables, gift certificates and logos to properly thank them on social media 3. Attend support group events to establish a relationship with parents and care takers to improve retention of participants. 4. Assist with securing meeting and or event space. 5. Keep a running list of attendees to inform them of upcoming activities.
11217.title: Administration Volunteer

11217.description: READ 718 is a non-profit literacy center that provides tutoring and literacy workshops to low-income students in grades 3-8. We are looking for dedicated, reliable, caring, positive people who are committed to working with a child at least one hour a week, from July 5-25 . On average, students lose two months of reading skills over the summer, and they start the academic year with achievement levels lower than where they were at the beginning of summer break . This phenomenon is referred to as summer slide. READ 718’s Summer Reading Room is intended to keep kids engaged and reading over the summer in order to prevent this setback. Literacy Tutor Requirements: excellent literacy and communication skills must be at least 18 years of age and have high school diploma available for a minimum of one hour a week on Mondays, Tuesdays, and/or Wednesdays Time slots: 3:00-4:00pm, 4:00-5:00pm, or 5:00-600pm (tutors can volunteer for up to 3 hours a day) experience with children and/or adolescents interest in literacy education practices positive, collaborative attitude must agree to background check must attend one, 2.5-hour training session APPLICATION: Please fill out the application on our website at www.read718.org and contact Program Coordinator, Alice Walker at alice@read718.org with any questions. Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduling form.
11217.title: Seeking Volunteer Tutors for July 2018

11217.description: Responsibilities: Assist Billing Manager with any billing responsibilities. Help with annual budget, keeping up with operational billing standards, providing analysis of each department, helping to identify and resolve billing problems, and tracking status of bills. Overall Responsibilities: -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. -Assist in drafting and the finalization of bills, sending to recipients. -Reaching out to each department maintaining monthly statements and balances. -Assist in preparing a monthly billing statement for entire organization. -Ensure billing and payment information are accurate and up to date. -Assist in identifying and resolving invoice disputes and errors. -Monitor status and dates of bills. -Process and maintain invoices through spreadsheets and files. -Working with each department for yearly budget. Competencies: -Has/working towards a degree in accounting, finance or related field. -Experience with bookkeeping. -Excellent organizational and communication skills. -Competency with Google docs, Quickbooks, and Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and Quickbooks.
11217.title: Billing Department Assistant

11217.description: This Program deals with businesses who are interested in joining with A Free Bird. Things such as product placement can occur with A Free Bird, getting a large portion of the proceeds for a certain time period. This requires a lot of patience and persistence from the individual who wants to be the Coordinator. Reaching out via email, phone, and speaking to companies and following up with companies that you did not receive an answer from. Thinking outside of the box, we are looking for someone who has the ability to come up with incentives for companies to collaborate with A Free Bird and how they will benefit from working with us. Following up with companies that you have reached out to and see if they are interested in the program. Coming up with ideas for companies to work with the AFB and help raise funds for our Programs Dept. Travel to companies location. Have available 10-12 hours per week to devote your time to the organization Be comfortable with Google Docs creating forms and excel spreadsheets to keep track of companies Organized and professional demeanor Great communication skills. Willing to work individually as well as in a team. Be comfortable on all social media platforms and use it to reach out to many more individuals.
11217.title: Get Excited Coordinator Volunteer

11217.description: A Fundraising Program which enables the public to provide direct sponsorship to the child. Reaching out to companies and individuals who are willing to sponsor a child that the organization has within the Programs Department. This person must feel comfortable with phone calls, speaking to people in person, and reaching out via email. You will report back to the VP of Fundraising, creating graphs and charts using the Google Docs. Must be comfortable with Social media and be able to post about the organization and what sponsor a child has to offer the community. Being in contact with the Programs Department on the children that are available and what company will be sponsoring which child. Have availability of 10-12 hours per week. Understanding of Google Docs, and Excel Spreadsheets Organized and professional Great Communication Skills Be fluent on all social media platforms. Willing to work individually as well as in a team environment. Report back to the VP of Fundraising with progress as well as the Founder of the organization. Have some availability on the weekend. Be comfortable on social media platforms
11217.title: Sponsor a Child Coordinator Volunteer

11217.description: This is a program where we are given and pass along free instruments to the children so that they can use it to practice their musical talent. We also donate equipment to hospitals. This person must be able to feel comfortable reaching out to companies via email, phone, as well as in person. Must be willing to find musical instruments that companies either would like to donate or give away to the organization and then give to the children. Person must be willing to travel and give instruments to children and take photos for our social media pages. Working closely with the Programs Department and with the coordination of events where the children will receive the instruments as well as coordinating times that the children will be available to meet with you and the programs department to drop off the instruments to the children. Be ready to work with moving companies. Be organized as you will be keeping track of the instruments we have available. Must feel comfortable sending emails, speaking over the phone, and speaking in person to people. Great communication skills and technical skills when it comes to devices. Must be willing to travel to the storage unit and childs home as well as the hospital Be available 10-12 hours per week. Must be available to come into the office and work from home Must have own laptop/computer to work from and have a smartphone device Familiar with Google Docs Willing to work individually as well as in a team. Be comfortable with social media as you will be posting and reaching out to companies via social media outposts.
11217.title: Give Arts Coordinator Volunteer

11217.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year and in order to help as many kids as possible, we are seeking a Public Relations Coordinator/Manager volunteer who can commit 15-20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months(150 hours). Responsibilities: Working with a small team, conceptualize and implement traditional and social media strategies and campaigns aimed at generating coverage of AFB's programs, key advocacy issues and marketing and celebrity-driven campaigns. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Produce blogs and other content for external publication. Edit commentaries produced by other AFB staff. Coach and supervise PR Intern Assistants. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Expand and nurture AFB's mainstream and social media network. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Build and manage our Twitter-sphere. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Help manage the AFB's media database, build lists and track media coverage. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities Keen insight into the news business and understanding of what makes journalists tick Proven ability to identify and market good story ideas Prefer candidate with local or hyperlocal media relationships A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11217.title: PR Social Media Coordinator

11215.description: Puppetry Arts is hosting an outdoors puppet festival Saturday June 23 11am-3pm Assist with set up, run crafts and activities, and breakdown. Lunch is provided. Guests include lots of puppeteers R2D2 and Darth Vader of Star Wars Volunteer CHOICES two shifts: 8am-12pm OR 12pm-4pm Groups welcome Kids 16yo and up welcome EMAIL US. No Phone calls please. We do not take volunteers over the phone. Emails only. Thanks! www.puppetryarts.org
11215.title: Puppetry Arts Festival

11215.description: We are looking for committed volunteers for our school programs! This spring we have two school programs volunteers can help support us with. Our Citizen Science program emphasizes the role of citizen scientists and the importance of advocating for our waterways. Citizen Science program volunteers will become familiar with water quality testing parameters, protocols and help lead groups of students through different tests. Our service-learning program introduces students to the Gowanus Canal, its polluted history and the steps to making a healthier ecosystem through stewardship. Service Learning program volunteers will engage students in stewardship activities - such as gardening, caring for street trees, and propagating plants in our native plant nursery. This is perfect for volunteers that are interested or have prior experience in education. No prior knowledge on topics or activities are needed. Programs are reserved are for Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Based on their availability and interest volunteers can help with one program or both. Volunteers must be able to commit to regularly volunteering throughout the spring season- April till June. Please email education@gowanuscanalconservancy.org if you are interested in one or both school programs.
11215.title: Ongoing Education Volunteer

10035.description: Volunteers are needed to help with this wonderful event to find a cure for brain tumors! The New York City Walk will be held at Randall's Island in NYC on Saturday, June 23, 2018. We have volunteer opportunities to assist with set up on Friday, June 22nd during the day and a large number of opportunities available on walk day ranging from registration and incentive distribution to cheerleading for our walkers, to solicitation of donated goods to help make the event go smoothly for all. If you're unavailable that day but want to help distribute marketing materials or help with sponsorships please reach out today! To see a full list of volunteer options visit: http://events.braintumor.org/events/new-york-brain-tumor-walk/volunteer-roles/ We are seeking new members to join our walk planning committee for those who want to get involved year-round to help plan and execute the walk. All funds raised through our events allow the National Brain Tumor Society to advance research and public policy to improve the availability of new and better treatments, and fuel the discovery of a cure for brain tumors. Volunteers are the bedrock our existence and this special event would not be possible without you. Thank you for your time and generosity.
10035.title: New York City Brain Tumor Walk

10035.description: On Sunday, July 1, 2018, we are hosting \"Paving the Way\" to recognize our young women for successfully completing their first year of college! They will share their successes and how they are paving the way to create the life they’ve dreamed of by being one step closer to earning a college degree. We celebrate our young women with a special rite of passage that will further strengthen our sisterhood. During the event, we have the following needs with their respective times: Set-up 1:00 pm - 2:30 pm Decor, registration, setting up gifts and registration, etc. Check-in/Registration 2:30 pm - 3:15 pm Checking in guests Clean-up/Break down 4: 45 pm - 6 pm
10035.title: Event Volunteer! Paving the Way to Success

10035.description: Groove With Me 2018 Summer Program: We are currently accepting applications for Volunteer Dance Teachers for our Summer Grooves Program at Groove With Me, Inc. Groove With Me is a free dance school for girls (ages 4-18) in East Harlem. We engage girls during the idle out-of-school hours when 90% of youth violence occurs; and we seek to decrease teen pregnancy, truancy, crime, violence, prostitution, substance abuse and gang related activity. East Harlem has the highest unmet need for after school programming of any neighborhood in NYC. By volunteering you will provide much needed out-of-school time safety - and arts programming. At Groove With Me, we strive to provide a forum for girls to develop critical thinking skills as well as a growth mindset through Dance. Summer Programming 2018 Schedule Will Offer 2 Sessions: Classes meet 1x per week for 1 hour Session 1 will run from July 2th - July 26th (4 weeks) Session 2 will run from July 30th- August 16th (3 weeks) Teachers can select which session to teach. If you are interested in this opportunity, please give me a call at 212-987-5910 or reach me via email at beatriz@groovewithme.org Beatriz Coronel, MA Program Director Groove With Me, Inc. 186 E 123rd St NY, NY 10035 Phone: 212-987-5910 Fax: 212-987-5080 www.groovewithme.org
10035.title: Volunteer Dance Teachers Needed For A Youth Development Dance Program (Groove With Me)

10036.description: You will have a great time meeting as many people as possible at various events and inviting them to upcoming productions that make a difference and begin crucial conversations.
10036.title: Fun social butterfly volunteering!

10036.description: Help rescue some lunch leftovers from an office in Midtown West! We will deliver the food to Travelers Hotel, located at 274 W 40th street. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-45 pounds.
10036.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Fridays 3PM!

10030.description: Future Giants is a non profit that has operated in NYC for over 11 years. We specialize in preparing High School students for the social and academic challenges they will encounter after graduation. We have a 100 college acceptance rate and a 99 % on time High School Graduation rate. Last year we created and published a High school book that is being used in several High Schools. We are seeking Volunteers that have a direct or indirect contact with the Mayors of Baltimore and or D.C. It is our hope to recreate our success in those cities as well as open our first multi organization youth center (A.C.E) Future Giants is planning to Launch our Academic + Community = Excellence If you have any contacts with the Mayors of either Baltimore ,MD or D.C ( or the Governor) we would like your assistance in helping thousands of young people achieve their dreams.
10030.title: Reference to Mayor of D.C. and or Baltimore

10033.description: Food pantry volunteers are needed in Washington Heights. The pantry is open Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. This client choice food pantry serves New Yorkers in need. Volunteers will assist clients in choosing food and help keep the pantry stocked. Volunteers must be comfortable with light to moderate lifting and movement.
10033.title: Washington Heights Food Pantry Volunteer

10032.description: Behind the Book, a non-profit literacy organization serving high-needs New York City public schools, is seeking an experienced volunteer to shoot video of a program workshop for students at a Washington Heights middle school. Please contact volunteer@bheindthebook.org, including a link to your work, if you'd like to document this hour-long session: Tuesday, June 12th 11:15 AM - 12:15 PM MS 328 , 401 West 164th St. between Amsterdam & Edgecombe (1 or A to 168th St.; B/D to 155th St ; or C to 163rd St at Amsterdam Ave. About the workshop: After reading David Barclay Moore’s novel, The Stars Beneath Our Feet, about a 12-year-old boy in Harlem reeling from his brother’s death, and meeting with the author, eighth-graders developed their own campaigns against gun violence. They worked with Behind the Book coaches to research statistics for gun violence citywide and in their own communities, then designed and created posters that communicate their messages. Their presentations of their work will be the topic of the short video compilation. Notes: Since there's a only short period to shoot, and we want to feature as many students as possible, a simple set-up is best. It's also difficult to navigate in the classroom's limited space, so we don't recommend a tripod. The program coordinator will provide more information on specs. Contact Emily Rosenberg at volunteer@behindthebook.org for more information.
10032.title: Videographer for literacy program workshop

07430.description: ENROLLMENT FOR VOLUNTEERS FOR PONY POWER THERAPIES SUMMER SEMESTER IS NOW OPEN! Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Summer Semester! Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as Lead Walkers. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on Monday, June 25th and runs through to August 23rd. Morning sessions: 8:45 to 10:45AM (except June 25th to 28th: 8:45AM to 12:15PM) Afternoon sessions: 2:30 to 6:00PM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.

Under the supervision of a certified riding instructor, the side walker walks next to the horse to provide support to the rider as needed. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. 07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist with our \" All HANDs In\" ( Horse Assisted Nature Driven) after-school enrichment program. All HANDs In provides an interactive, farm-based, non-riding enrichment program that offers participants, ages 14 - 21, the opportunity to enjoy a unique and unparalleled after-school experience. Sample activities include Grooming horses, lead-walking horses, preparing a whole food-based afternoon snack, stall and barn management, small animal (goats & pigs) care, and planting and care of the farm's fruits and vegetables. RESPONSIBILITES Work under the direction of the Afterschool Program Coordinator/Structured Learning Instructor Assist program participants in activities Provide one on one educational or physical assistance as needed Set up and break down of program materials/supplies Attend required trainings/meetings ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR ENRICHMENT PROGRAM ASSISTANT Mandatory training with Afterschool Program Coordinator/Structured Learning Instructor. Minimum age of 17 years with reliable transportation Must be able to commit to a full semester of programing (10 to 12 weeks - Tuesday and/or Thursdays afternoon from 4 to 6 PM) Must be able to lift 30 pounds Must be able to physically participate in a 90-minute session in both indoor and outdoor activities. SCHEDULE: Tuesdays: Mar 20 Mar 27 Apr 10 Apr 17 Apr 24 May 8 May 15 May 22 Jun 5 Jun 12 Thursdays: Mar 22 Mar 29 Apr 12 Apr 19 Apr 26 May 10 May 17 May 24 Jun 7 Jun 14 Interested volunteers can contact volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call 201-934-1001 for more information.
07430.title: After School Enrichment Program Assistant

07733.description: Do you want to volunteer at the Vans Warped Tour in your city? Are you passionate about youth empowerment and exercising your right to vote? Then sign up to volunteer with I’m Down To Vote at your local date of the final cross-country Vans Warped Tour! We are looking for 2 volunteers per date to help us encourage young people 13+ to commit to voting when they turn 18! Please note we are strictly non-partisan and do not represent any political parties. We have one agenda: To encourage everyone eligible to vote! Additionally, you will be talking with Warped Tour attendees and also be helping with day-of promotion of the tent. If interested, please fill out this form! http://imdowntovote.org/volunteer-with-us/
07733.title: Vans Warped Tour I'm Down To Vote Volunteer - Holmdel, NJ

11357.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Friday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11357.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at College Point Multiplex in Whitestone, NY!

11554.description: We are having our second annual BBQ to support breast cancer comfort. Last year we had fun and we are looking to have a great time this year! We are looking for volunteers to help setup and breakdown, help with guests, help with games, and have fun!
11554.title: Summer BBQ Help!

11554.description: We are having a summer BBQ to support breast cancer comfort and looking for a face painter to volunteer their time. This is our second annual BBQ and looking to have lots more fun this year!!!
11554.title: Face Painter for Breast Cancer Summer BBQ

07960.description: Becoming a peer support group facilitator at Good Grief is a unique, engaging, and transformative volunteer experience. Facilitators at Good Grief help to create a safe and empathic environment for grieving families after the death of a loved one by helping foster resiliency and develop healthy coping skills that will serve them for the rest of their lives. Good Grief is respected as a national leader in delivering childhood bereavement services. Since its founding in 2004, the mission of Good Grief has been to provide free and unlimited support to grieving children, teens, young adults, and their families after the death of a parent or sibling.
07960.title: Become a peer support facilitator!

07960.description: Becoming a peer support group facilitator at Good Grief is a unique, engaging, and transformative volunteer experience. Facilitators at Good Grief help to create a safe and empathic environment for grieving families after the death of a loved one by helping foster resiliency and develop healthy coping skills that will serve them for the rest of their lives. Good Grief is respected as a national leader in delivering childhood bereavement services.
