07960.title: Become a Peer Support Group Facilitator at Good Grief

07960.description: We are beginning to recruit interested volunteers for our upcoming New Jersey Confidential Sexual Violence Victim Advocate (CSVA) training, which is slated to begin in July 2018 (5 Weeks, Tuesdays and Thursday from 6PM-10PM). During the 40 hour training volunteers are educated about topics regarding sexual assault statistics, prevention, and response. Crisis intervention and advocacy support skills are taught and guest speakers, including law enforcement, military experts, and mental health professionals present information. When the volunteer completes the training and receives the CSVA status, they are required to manage the crisis hotline for three 12 hour shifts per month. (The hotline is forwarded to the volunteer's telephone for their shifts.) In addition to hotline, the advocate's second responsibility per shift is to accompany survivors of sexual assault to the hospital as needed. Although this is a challenging volunteer position, the experience is very rewarding (and looks great on a resume too)! Join our team and support survivors!
07960.title: Sexual Assault Response Team Advocate Training

11214.description: We are looking for a Yoga Instructor to teach a group of high school students at New Utrecht HS in Brooklyn. The dates are 7/9 - 8/3 Mons. and Weds. from 11:30am-1pm. We can provided MTA travel expenses.
11214.title: Yoga Instructor

10302.description: About The Volunteer Role: MRNY is seeking a volunteer with teaching experience to teach a citizenship class to ESL students looking to pass their naturalization exams to become US citizens. MRNY offers a collaborative environment for volunteers who take part of this opportunity. The volunteer will: Look closely at the materials and lesson templates provided by our staff to adapt the lesson plans/materials to fit a 2 hr class. Send the MRNY staff materials for printing or bring printed material (we have a printer in the office available for your use). Teach the civics class on Mondays to multi-level English learners seeking to take a naturalization interview. Communicate during the evening with the volunteers recruited to do mock exams to ensure that students are given adequate practice Maintain effective communication with the team regarding anything that seems unclear, questions s/he may have, the status of the class and the students, and other things related to the class. We also ask that volunteers respond in a timely manner to emails from staff about the class. Training and support that MRNY can provide: Orientation about MRNY materials for citizenship class General Orientation (about MRNY, the volunteer role, the students, community, collaborative approaches, etc...) A couple of class observation in our Queens location (the volunteer observes the citizenship classes taught by MRNY staff in our Queens location) Phone meetings (scheduled with the volunteer) A room for teaching Student enrollment and pre-testing Printer, laptop, projector and speakers are available for use Our Volunteer Community: It is important to us that participants have a strong desire to support and work with the immigrant community. Great teamwork, effective communication skills, a positive attitude, and an interest in adult education as it relates to student speakers of other languages, or the desire to learn about these is required from all our volunteers. ​
10302.title: Strengthen Immigrant Communities- TEACH A CITIZENSHIP CLASS

10301.description: We are Community Agency for Senior Citizens, Inc. We have been in Staten Island for over 40 years. We only serve Older Adults. The program is called the Friendly Visiting Program. The program began in January/2017. We look to \"Match\" you with an Older Adult. The program asks that you spend one hour in the Client's home. While visiting the Client, you can have a cup of coffee/tea, play a table top game, cards, read a book together, watch a movie. The visit is what you both decide upon. This is a building block relationship. So far, many of our \"Match's\" have become good friends and look forward to these weekly visits.
10301.title: Do You Want to Brighten Someone's Day? Volunteer's Are the Sunshine that Homebound Adult's Need
10301.org: COMMUNITY AGENCY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS INC

10028.description: Do you have a few hours to spend helping us devlop programs for young mothers and their babies? The mission of Friends of NYC Nurse-Family Partnereship is to improve the lives of babies and their mothers by providing enhanced benefits for the nationally renowned Nurse-Family Partnership. NFP sends registered nurses to make regular visits to first-time, low-income mothers, from the time the mothers are pregnant until their babies are 2. Friends of NYC NFP is developing and leading LEAP (Learn, Eat, and Play) programs which help the mothers meet and socialize with other young moms while learning about nutrition, finance, making toys out of household objects and much more. We need VOLUNTEERS who can help us create interesting play times for the babies. We'd like to: Showing mothers the importance of interactions with their baby Teach about a rich learning environment Show exercises which will allow babies to explore and learn Programs are held around midday during the week at locations in the boroughs of NYC. If interested, please send resume and phone number.
10028.title: Pre-School Teacher
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Are you a singer, guitar player, or have other musical talents appropriate for young mothers and their babies? The babies are all under 2 years of age. If you have appropriate musical experience and talent and would like to entertain in such a situation and you are available week days, we would like to hear from you. Events typically last 2-3 hours; frequency would be once a quarter or more. Please send a note describing your musical background;experience with very young children a big plus. SEND YOUR RESUME AND PHONE NUMBER.
10028.title: Guitarist or Keyboard Player for Mother/Baby Events
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Enthusiastic volunteers are needed to introduce school children to art and museums. We will train you to give guided tours at the Brooklyn Museum of Art and Metropolitan Museum of Art, and to go into the classroom to prepare the students for their visit. Tours take place Monday through Friday, during the school year, between the hours of 10am and 1pm. ArtWorks volunteers are in 20 schools throughout the five boroughs and our classroom teachers love us!
10028.title: "Introduce Children to Art and Museums"

10029.description: Help us commemorate the graduation of our College Readiness students by volunteering to photograph this year's Awards Ceremony! Union Settlement hosts this event each year for participants in our College Readiness program, where we help high school juniors and seniors with the college search and application process while also preparing them for the college experience since many will be first-generation college students. Our celebration will also include the awarding of a scholarship to a deserving student in honor of a former Board member how has supported Union Settlement's work in the East Harlem community. Day: Wednesday, June 13, 2018 Time: 6pm - 7:30pm Where: Hunter College (exact location will be sent upon confirmation) Volunteer must have their own equipment. Interested volunteers should email volunteers@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"College Readiness Volunteer Photographer\" and a link to your past work. Thank you!
10029.title: Volunteer Photographer needed for our College Readiness Awards Ceremony!

10029.description: Union Settlement Senior Services is looking for Volunteers willing to provide their services to make sandwiches for a health festival. Volunteers will help prepare sandwiches, clean and wash vegetables and fruit, and assemble cold packs for the festival. When: Wednesday, June 13th from 9am to 2pm Where: Union Settlement in East Harlem - Jefferson Senior Center -2205 First Avenue (114th Street and First Avenue) Interested individuals or groups should email Jeanette Iturbides -Volunteer Coordinator at Jiturbides@unionsettlement.org
10029.title: Sandwich Prep Needed for Health Festival

10029.description: EHTP seeks passionate volunteers to work with elementary and middle school students during our summer program! Our summer program runs Monday through Friday, and volunteers play a huge role in making the summer successful. Volunteers can choose between the morning or afternoon shifts or do a full day. In the mornings, volunteers support our teachers and scholars during academic instruction. Including: Providing logistical and operational support to their assigned classroom Supporting students during academic lessons in one-on-one and small group settings In the afternoons, volunteers support during field trips, outdoor activities, and enrichment clubs. Including: Providing logistical and operational support during club time (i.e. music, dance, art etc.) Engaging with students in club and outdoor activities such as soccer and field time Attending field trips with students Volunteers must commit to a minimum of 3 shifts a week or 2 full days for the full 4 weeks of program. When : July 2 - July 30, 2018; Monday - Friday Times : 7:45am - 12:15pm (Morning) and/or 12:00pm - 4:00pm (Afternoon) All interested volunteers must apply online here: http://bttr.im/ubhw2 If you have any questions, please contact our Associate, Volunteers & Interns, Raúl Lazo, at volunteerinfo@ehtp.org Requirements Volunteers must be at least 14 years old Summer Program is a highly active environment and volunteers must be able to climb multiple flights of stairs, carry heavy boxes, stand for a minimum of 4 hours a day, feel comfortable supervising children in outdoor and indoor settings, and participate in physical activities such as running and sports Acceptance is contingent on clearance of a Criminal Background and Medical Check (forms provided during application process)
10029.title: Volunteer in Our Summer Program & Support Our Scholars!

10029.description: DREAM, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer T-ball coaches to work with youth ages 5-7 in practices and games. Coaches teach T-ball and provide youth with opportunities to play, learn and grow; inspiring them to recognize their potential and realize their dreams. Each coach serves as a member of a small coaching staff. There are powerful rewards gained from the DREAM coaching experience. DREAM volunteer coaches can have a direct and noticeable impact on the positive development of the youth they coach. The ideal candidate is passionate about youth development, has experience working with youth, and can commit to attending six Saturday practices and games in July/August, as well as a one-day pre-season coaches training in June. Roles and Responsibilities: Guide a team of 16-18 youth through practices and games; Ensure youth safety on the field; Provide a fun and positive, team-based environment; Attend all practices and games on six Saturdays in July and August. Qualifications: Passionate about youth development; Understand the power of teamwork; Have the ability to create a positive, team-based environment focused on teaching T-ball; Organized, energetic and flexible; Skilled communicators; Experience in baseball/softball a plus; Able to commit to six Saturdays, in July and August; At least 18 years of age. Hours: Coaches conduct practices and games for an hour and a half on six Saturday mornings or afternoons from 7/7/18 to 8/11/18. Coaches must be able to commit to attend all six Saturday coaching sessions during the summer, as well as the coach training day in June. DREAM provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10029.title: Volunteer T-Ball Coaches!

10029.description: We need caring, committed child care volunteers to assist in the our Building Bridges group, an art therapy group for immigrant moms who have experienced loss and trauma. This groupo helps support healing through art creation and art activities. This position requires empathy, caring for children in a group setting. The moms are in the group, so you are part of the Building Bridges group. Assist with children in the group (moms bring them along, help set up/clean up; helping in the facilitating of the the art activities of the mom. Spanish speaking helpful, but not necessary. An interest or background in art therapy helpful, but not necessary. Class meets on Thursday mornings, from 9 am to 12 pm. Please email the Volunteer Director with your resume to tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: Assist with Child Care needs in our Art Therapy Group with Moms on Thursdays

10026.description: GiGi's Playhouse NYC is a Down Syndrome Achievement Center based in Harlem and serving the 5 boroughs. During the summer, we offer a series of unique educational opportunities for the community to learn vital life skills and learn with their peers. Summer Horizons (ages 20+) is an educational and recreational summer program where participants with Down syndrome experience NYC, and practice important life and job skills, from navigating public spaces, to money management, all while socializing with their peers and visiting some of Manhattan's best cultural offerings. Volunteers are needed to work one-to-one with participants and guide them through the week. Prior experience preferred but not required. Partial week volunteering available, but priority will be given to those who can commit to the full week. Training provided.
10026.title: Summer Mentors for Adults with Down Syndrome
10026.org: GiGi's Playhouse, Down Syndrome Awareness Centers

10026.description: Each Wednesday, we prep & serve a simple vegetarian meal offering in Central Harlem for anyone who needs a meal. One can help cook and/or serve and/or clean up. Time commitment is flexible: 2 & 1/2 hours to prep/cook, 1 hour to set up/serve, 1 hour clean up. One can help out with any part of the meal. Any level of skill is accepted.
10026.title: Volunteer To Cook & Serve Every Wednesday

11226.description: Brooklyn Take Steps is one of the Foundation’s leading fundraising events in the nation. Help make our event a success. We’re making some great improvements to our festival, walk and finish areas. Share this special event with us! Nearly 1 in 200 Americans live each day with Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis, life-changing digestive diseases. Living with these inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) can be painful and isolating. The Crohn's & Colitis Foundation is dedicated to curing Crohn's and colitis, and to improving the quality of life of children and adults affected by these diseases. The Take Steps community also offers a safe, supportive environment for patients and families. Patients connect with others familiar with the ups and downs of IBD, as well as the friends who support their journey. The Foundation has invested almost $300 million in research to date, enabling groundbreaking treatments and greatly enhancing lives. Make a Difference Today! There are four shifts available: volunteers can take as many opportunities to contribute as they wish. Set-up: 11:00am - 5:00pm Unloading supplies Arrange barricades Decorations Signage Assist vendors Festival: 4:30pm - 9:00pm Festival Kick-off Kid Zone Distribute T-shirts, incentives, food informational materials Usher participants Walk Guide & Spirit Crew: 6:00pm - 8:00pm Event Breakdown: 8:00pm - 10:00pm We cannot make it happen without your help! Please contact us if you have more questions.
11226.title: 2018 Brooklyn Take Steps for Crohn’s & Colitis in Prospect Park
11226.org: Crohn's & Colitis Foundation - Greater NY Chapter

10024.description: If you’d like to help your community and the park, join us for this Community Volunteer event to help paint the iron fences throughout the park! These projects are great ways to meet other volunteers or just explore a different area of the park. Community volunteer events take place rain or shine. Volunteer projects are dependent on the season and the needs of the park. Closed toe work shoes required. Do not bring additional bags, as there is really no place to store belongings. Email: grassroots@riversideparknyc.org or call (212) 870-3073 for more details or to register to volunteer.
10024.title: Paint the Park Black Day at Riverside Park

10024.description: Volunteer tutors needed for low-income students for summer session from 7/5/18-8/17/18. You will be matched one-to-one with a student for just two hours per week. Students range in age from 7-18 (entering 2nd grade through 12th grade). There are no weekend hours available.
10024.title: Summer Volunteer Tutors Needed!

10025.description: Each year, on the longest day, Care for the Homeless and our allies take a few hours to recognize the stories of our homeless and formerly homeless neighbors. The Summer Solstice Success Celebration is an observance developed by Care for the Homeless in New York City and first held in 2014 to both celebrate success in overcoming homelessness and as an effort to de-stigmatize and humanize people experiencing homelessness in New York City. We are recruiting volunteers to assist with various duties at this event, including food service, set-up, break-down, etc. Where: Broadway Presbyterian Church, 601 West 114th Street, NY, New York 10025 When: June 21st. Time: 3:30pm - 7pm Who: 6+ Superstar Volunteers
10025.title: Celebrate Housing and Healthcare Successes at Care for the Homeless's Annual Summer Solstice Event

10025.description: Volunteers are needed for the Annual PFF Walk taking place in Central Park on Saturday, June 23rd. The PFF Walk is the Pulmonary Fibrosis Foundation’s national fundraising event with walks taking place in New York, Chicago, and Washington, D.C. Join us as we unite the community, raise funds, build awareness, and sustain vital programs that help people with PF and their families live better lives. Volunteer opportunities include: General Setup: Help set up tables, chairs, signs and other miscellaneous items Tear Down: Help take down and pack up tables, chairs, signs, and other miscellaneous items after the Walk concludes Registration: Welcome & register walkers T-Shirt Distribution: Help pass out T-shirts to walkers Course Marshalls: Help direct walkers along the walk route Food Distribution: Prepare and hand out food and beverages to walkers
10025.title: PFF Walk

10025.description: Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Summer 2018 session. The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City. As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! How we do it: The Parris Foundation curriculum combines innovative and interactive software and teaching techniques with hand-ons interdisciplinary experiments and activities to keep our students engaged with their passion for science and math! About The Parris Foundation: The Parris Foundation is dedicated to promoting educational opportunities and fostering awareness in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through scholarships and community outreach programs. The Parris Foundation's S.T.E.M.ulating Minds: Weekend Enrichment Programs provide extended learning opportunities to supplement and enhance in-school learning.
10025.title: Summer 2018 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

10025.description: The New Jewiish Home, Manhattan Division has a wide variety of opportunities for high school and college students to volunteer with over the summer vacation. Opportunities vary and we will try our best to meet your interest Opportunities include but not limited to: Recreation Assistant (Bingo, Games, Exercise, Arts & Crafts, Nail Spa) Pharamacy (selective, limited spots) Library Assistant (upkeep of shelving, assisting book selections, assisting computer users) Clerical/Office Assistant Please apply online at the following link: https://www.volgistics.com/ex/portal.dll/ap?ap=1114206372 Please mention Volunteer Match & Summer Volunteering in your application If you have any questions - Please contact Jessica at JSinovoi@jewishhome.org
10025.title: Summer Volunteer at The New Jewish Home (HS & College students)
10025.org: The New Jewish Home, Manhattan Division

10023.description: We are seeking enthusiastic, creative, industrious, responsible, punctual, and best of all, creative people who can generate fun every moment of the STEM summer day camp experience. Depending upon your experience, you will work as a STEM Teacher, STEM Junior Teacher, Head Counselor, or Group Leader in the classroom, in offsite locations, or in the gymnasium/outdoor playground. Must have tons of energy, a willingness to make a fool of yourself for the sake of making someone smile, the ability to give \"warm fuzzies\" on a daily basis, and a desire to have FUN! If you have experience in any of the following, this camp is for you: visual art, music, dramatic art, mad science, coding, maker faire, financial literacy, entrepreneurship, community service, activism, literacy, education, chess, juggling, sports, yoga, fire throwing, marching band, drill team, gardening, cooking, learning, sharing the love and joys of learning and making friends with children.
10023.title: Teach kids how to code, engineer, and love Science!  Looking For STEM Summer Camp Teachers - NYC

10023.description: Hola! Somos una organizaci?n sin fines de lucro que ayuda a la comunidad inmigrante latina y no latina de Nueva York en el aprendizaje del idioma ingl?s, en la preparaci?n para el examen de ciudadan?a estadounidense y en el desarrollo de otras actividades de empoderamiento para la comunidad inmigrante. Tambi?n ofrecemos clases de espa?ol para no hispanohablantes, con lo cual contribuimos adem?s a la difusi?n de la cultura y valores hispanos en los Estados Unidos. Estamos a la b?squeda de profesores de Espa?ol (voluntarios) para nuestras clases de primavera 2018 (mayo 3 - junio 22 2018). Las clases son una vez por semana (jueves) de 6:00 pm a 9:00 pm. Esta es una posici?n de voluntariado (sin pago). Si te gusta ayudar a la gente y a la comunidad por favor comun?cate con nosotros respondiendo este aviso. Habr? una sesi?n de entrenamiento previo al inicio de clases fecha tentativa. Muchas gracias!
10023.title: Volunteer Spanish Teachers

10023.description: Centro NYC seeks dedicated volunteers with a passion for intercultural exchange and learning who can be available weekday evenings to ensure the smooth running of our ESL and Spanish programming at our new home near Lincoln Center. Core responsibilities: -Greeting students and managing class check-in, as well as new student registrations -Facilitating nightly \"intercambio\" break sessions between classes, by preparing/breaking down snack preparations, managing snack sales, and encouraging students to practice language skills -Participating in major marketing initiatives for the organization -Admin office tasks such as assisting teaching staff, checking voicemails and returning calls Commitment: Volunteers will be expected to meet either Tuesdays OR Thursday evenings from 6:00-9:00pm beginning Tuesday, May 1 st and ending on Thursday, June 21 st. We also hope volunteers can be present during our end of term celebration on Friday, June 22 nd. If time constraints exist, there may be flexibility around start/end times for shifts. Eligibility: Foreign language experience a plus. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/ Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge.
10023.title: Operations/Admin Volunteer - Tuesday or Thursday Evenings

10023.description: Centro NYC, a non-profit organization serving the immigrant community in New York City, seeks volunteer ESL teachers for its 2018 spring term, beginning May 1 and continuing through June 22. However, we hope that you will continue to volunteer with us in the fall. Classroom English teaching experience is preferred. However we do recruit new teachers with strong English communication skills and a good feel for grammar, even if you don't know all the rules! New teachers are partnered with and mentored by experienced teachers. Time commitment: One Tuesday or Thursday evening per week teaching plus the time required for lesson preparation (usually every other week.) Classes meet Tuesdays and Thursdays from 6:30-9:00 p.m. near Lincoln Center in Manhattan, and teachers are asked to arrive 6-6:15 to set up. In addition, there will be one staff meeting in April, and possibly one mid-semester. We have openings for teachers of beginning, intermediate, and advanced students. Please respond by email to Susan at susan@CentroNYC.org. Include your resume and tell us the evening(s) that you're available for teaching. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/
10023.title: Adult English / ESL Teachers ? VOLUNTEERS NEEDED!

11221.description: ACE Integration Head Start is looking for a person to assist in updating their web page , printed materials, E.g. Brochures - Flyers and Parent Handbooks.
11221.title: Writer -Content Manager Web /Brochure

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers is a 124-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. Our English as a Second Language program provides high quality, interactive instruction to a diverse student body. We are seeking a volunteer to facilitate an English Conversation Group for our higher level English for Speakers of Other Languages students. The volunteer will be responsible to facilitating group discussion that encourages participants to practice their English speaking skills in a supportive environment. The Conversation Group will meet on Thursdays, 1:00-2:00, July 12 - August 30.
10021.title: Summer Conversation Group Facilitator

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 124-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of integrated and effective services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year, on the East Side of Manhattan. We are seeking volunteers with strong computer skills to assist older adults with learning technology in our computer lab. Volunteers will be stationed in the lab to answer computer related questions from students. The lab meets Fridays, 10:00-12:00, July 13 - August 31.
10021.title: Summer Computer Lab Assistant

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 124-year old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. Our English as a Second Language program provides high quality, interactive instruction to a diverse student body. We seek to increase students' language skills, confidence in speaking and comprehension of English. Volunteers are needed to teach one class per week on Fridays, 9:30am-12:00pm from April 13 - June 15. Training and supervision are provided but volunteers will need to prepare weekly lesson plans for their class and write brief summaries of student progress.
10021.title: English as a Second Language Instructor

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premiere human services providers, is a 124-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated sevices on Manhattan's East Side. Our CARE program is an arts-based day program for older adults with dementia. The program provides a caring and engaging environment that allows participants to be involved in group and indvidulaized activities, while providing a respite for family caregivers. As a volunteer Program Assistant you will assist staff in leading therapeutic activities such as visual and performing arts projects, live music performances and health and welllness programs for our participants.
10021.title: Program Assistant - CARE Program for Older Adults with Dementia

10021.description: We are seeking a Japanese speaker to meet with a senior that speaks Japanese as part of Lenox Hill Neighborhood House's Friendly Visiting Program. Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, in partnership with the NYC Department for the Aging, connects volunteers with homebound older New Yorkers to have in home visits on a regular basis. For volunteers, friendly visiting offers the opportunity to cultivate a lasting friendship, to learn from a senior’s life experiences, and to benefit from the personal satisfaction derived from community service. Friendly visiting leads to the creation of meaningful relationships between older adults and volunteers, promoting intergenerational understanding. For the senior, friendly visiting provides a sense of connection to the outside world, something to look forward to, and a sense of contributing to society through sharing their wisdom, knowledge, talents and stories with you. Tasks: Have weekly social, in-home visits with an older adult you are matched with Provide monthly reports/updates to the Friendly Visiting program coordinator Requirements: Commit to being a Friendly Visitor for a minimum of six months Be comfortable establishing a relationship with an older adult Honest, mature, motivated, patient Ability to maintain confidentiality Willing and able to contact the program coordinator should problems arise Participate in an in-person interview Undergo and pass a background check and provide references Email monthly report of hours to coordinator
10021.title: Japanese Speaking Friendly Visitor Needed

11743.description: Help young parents learn to give positive behavioral feedback to their pre-school children. Volunteers interact with the childen in planned activities while the group leader counsels with parents. Thursdays from 1:00 - 3:00 in Huntington.
11743.title: Mommy and Me
11743.org: Family Service League of Suffolk County

11743.description: Who doesn't love the warmth and unconditional love from a beautiful four legged furry pet? If you love dogs, and I mean, really love dogs then you can be part of a rewarding experience. Our exclusive Pet Therapy program is currently looking for chaperones. We have committed pet therapy handlers who bring their trained and certified dogs to the hospital to visit our patients. As a chaperone you will be . . . escorting the handler and dog to the patient floors on various units. engaging and interact with our patients & families and wonderful caregivers. providing hand sanitizer to all who pet the dog. greeting patients and introducing the pet handler and pet therapy dog. able to commit to one day a week for a maximum of 2 hours, usually not more than an hour. The presence of a dog in a hospital setting allows the patients to feel more at home, as they do play a small part of the healing process. The immediate gratification you will see on the patients' and staffs' faces when they are interacting with the dog is truly amazing. There are known benefits for pet therapy visits . . . improves mood and overall well-being decreases stress and anxiety lowers blood pressure lets patients reminisce about their own animals If you are interested in volunteering in our program, please contact me for an interview. Alice Messina Patient Liaison Pet Therapy Coordinator 631-351-2399 amessina2@northwell.edu
11743.title: Pet Therapy Chaperone

08837.description: Canine Companions for Independence has an opening for an Event Chair and DogFest committee to lead the planning of the 2018 DogFest New Jersey Walk N Roll. Event Chair must be available to meet once a month for committee meetings and have ability to assist committee members in soliciting sponsors, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing the event. Position description is below but subject to change. Event Chair candidates will need to connect with Canine Companions staff before being approved for the position. DogFest Chairperson Work with Staff Partner to identify and recruit Committee Chairs. With the Committee Chairs, recruit volunteers to fill committee positions. Manage the committee through the planning process. Communicate with Staff Partner to ensure they are in the loop through the entire process. Serve as spokesperson for DogFest in the community Organization and communication skills to coordinate and lead committee meetings Have a well-developed network of potential sponsors, vendors and committee members Creativity to come up with ideas for fund-raising Ability to participate in meetings during work days and evenings both by phone and face to face in Irving Follow up skills needed to keep various committee info updated and on track Passion for the cause because it will come out in the message presented Ability and willingness to speak in public meetings and at Canine Companions events to promote DogFest and drive committee membership and event participation Ability to assist committee in soliciting sponsorships, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing event Previous event planning and fundraising experience helpful
08837.title: Dogfest Walk 'n Roll Chairperson or commitee member
08837.org: CANINE COMPANIONS FOR INDEPENDENCE - NORTHEAST REGION (Maine to Virginia)

08837.description: The Garden State Cat Club is looking for people to work as stewards at our upcoming Expo / Cat Show on July 21-22, 2018 at the NJ Convention and Exposition Center at the Raritan Center in Edison. Stewards get a small salary and free lunch. You must arrive at the show hall no later than 8:30am and judging ends around 4pm or whenever the judge is done as some take a bit longer. You must stay at your post at all times except for your lunch break and if there is a break between any of the classes. You will NOT be handling the cats. Only owners and judges may touch the cats in the show rings. For a description of what a steward does at a show, please read this: http://www.showcatsonline.com/x/i_love_ring_stewards_who.shtml
08837.title: Cat Show Steward
08837.org: Garden State Cat Club of NJ, Inc.

08837.description: We need volunteers at our annual Expo / show to help with the raffle table, security, hospitality and general errands. This is a HUGE 2-day event! It's held at the NJ Convention and Exposition Center at the Raritan Center in Edison. If you can work both days, that's great but we will love to have you for just one. For 2018, the show will be held on July 21-22. You MUST contact me ahead of the show dates. Volunteers do NOT handle any cats. Only cat owners and judges may handle any cats. WE ALSO NEED PEOPLE FOR SETUP ON FRIDAY 7/20 !!!
08837.title: Cat Show Volunteer
08837.org: Garden State Cat Club of NJ, Inc.

08837.description: Akhil Autism Foundation looking for volunteers who are passionate about teaching have some experience with special need children They will be teaming with parents and teach various subjects from grade level 1 to High school or higher or topics as per the students like. Its a no paid job at present can become paid in future depending how it goes. open minded reading to learn new learning style, passionate about working and analysing the individuals learning style. contact manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: Tutors needed special need children in NJ

08837.description: We are looking for Master of Science in Education (MS.Ed.) interns. Highly motivated professionals Willing to learn new upcoming teaching methods Willing to work with autism and other disabilities Training will be provided From Internship to Paid after school for 3 hrs per day please email manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: We are looking for Special educators interns.

08837.description: Hiring interns/college students with specialities in special education to work with our 16 year old son diagnosed with Autism. (Bachelor's or Masters degree education) Highly motivated and energetic professionals. Willing to learn new upcoming teaching methods (e.g. Ipad based communication) Training will be provided. 1-3 hrs per day. Contact Manisha Lad: 732-887-4263
08837.title: Help us find Tutor-Helper-Buddy for our son (16 yr old)

07306.description: CASA volunteers are ordinary people - men and women, retirees and busy professionals - who have the opportunity to directly influence a foster child's life across many significant and far-reaching concerns such as medical care, academics, and enrichment activities. We are looking for individuals with a desire to help children in need of one-on-one attention. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend an information session. Please join us for a half-hour to learn how you can make a difference in a foster child's life.
07306.title: Hudson County CASA Information Session

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 PM to 6:10 PM on Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: Joyful Summer Learning Program (Summer School)

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07018.description: As a Programming and Student Engagement Volunteer, your primary role would be to ensure that administrative tasks (data entry, outreach to parents, outreach to students, making flyers, etc.) are complete. On at least a weekly (high school students)/monthly (college students) basis, you would communicate with students to provide ongoing motivation, encouragement and connection to each other and the program. In addition, you would support and coordinate external activities such as volunteer opportunities, events and trips and more Programming and Student Engagement Volunteers should commit for at least 6 months and commit to up to 5 hours a week depending on projects and tasks.
07018.title: Programming and Student Engagement Volunteer - NY/NJ

10314.description: If you 55 years of age or older and looking for a way to stay active and healthy, are newly retired, or just have some free time on your hands - then volunteering is for you. The Retired and Senior Volunteer Program of the Community Service Society is a national program that matches people who want to help, with a volunteer assignment that best suits their skills and interests. The time commitment can be as little as 2 hours a day to several days a week -- depending on how much time you want to share. As a volunteer you can feed the hungry at soup kitchens and food pantries or by delivering meals to homebound elderly. You can visit the sick as a Hospice volunteer or nursing home friendly visitor. RSVP volunteers also help by tutoring children who are having difficulty learning to read, and by preparing adults and recent immigrants for the high school equivalency exam or to find employment. Some volunteers help by providing administrative support at local non-profit organizations, while others assist local museums and cultural institutions as docents. There is usually something for everyone! There are dozens of opportunities right here in Staten Island. To learn more about this program and to see if volunteering is right for you, call 718-494-3222 or email tdicostanzo@cssny.org. A little of your time can make a big difference in someone else’s life.
10314.title: Variety of oppotunities for Older Adults in Staten Island

10562.description: Volunteers should expect to work with several children during each 2 hour session. The children will have selected a book and then be matched up with a volunteer. After introductions the \"buddies\" will find a spot where they can work together for 20 minutes. The volunteer will encourage the student to read, help with specific words, pronunciation and comprehension. When they’ve finished the book the volunteer will help the child complete a worksheet. We give out \"passports\" to every child who registers for Summer Reading Buddies and each child gets a stamp on his passport for each day they attend. The volunteer will then bring the child back to our staff who will match them up with their next \"buddy\". Summer Reading Buddies volunteer opportunties are also available at the Yonkers Riverfront Library. Please contact us for further information. Everyone enjoys this program. Take a look at coverage by WPIX 11: http://www.jcy-wcp.com/summermediacraze.html
10562.title: Summer Reading Buddies

10019.description: Together One New York (TONY) is starting a new program for English classes. The opportunity will generally run on Monday to Thursday evenings from 6 to 9 PM. Teachers are expected to volunteer in hour and a half increments from 6-7:30 or 7:30-9:00. As a teacher you will be responsible for compiling a lesson plan, but you are welcome to use our extensive teaching material to structure classes. Prior teaching experience is a plus, but certainly not required as we have many first time teachers who have come in and successfully led our classes. TONY is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to all members of the NYC community, with a special emphasis on immigrants and language learning. In addition to language classes, we offer a variety of programs such as Citizenship Prep, TASC (high school equivalency), and beginner ESOL conversation. We look forward to expanding our outreach and positively impacting a greater portion of our city's immigrant community. For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/
10019.title: Volunteer English Teachers

10019.description: Together One New York (TONY) is starting a new program for Spanish classes. The opportunity will generally run on Monday to Thursday evenings from 6 to 9 PM. Teachers are expected to volunteer in hour and a half increments from 6-7:30 or 7:30-9:00. As a teacher you will be responsible for compiling a lesson plan, but you are welcome to use our extensive teaching material to structure classes. Prior teaching experience is a plus, but certainly not required as we have many first time teachers who have come in and successfully led our classes. TONY is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to all members of the NYC community, with a special emphasis on immigrants and language learning. In addition to language classes, we offer a variety of programs such as Citizenship Prep, TASC (high school equivalency), and beginner ESOL conversation. We look forward to expanding our outreach and positively impacting a greater portion of our city's immigrant community. For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/
10019.title: Volunteers needed to teach Spanish language

10019.description: We need volunteers to help out with general administrative and office work for our new organization, Together One New York (TONY). Volunteering slots are available on Monday to Thursday evenings from 6 to 9 PM. Ideally volunteers will be able to commit to the full time slot on any of those evenings, but if a shorter time frame is needed we can accommodate that as well. TONY is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to all members of the NYC community, with a special emphasis on immigrants and language learning. In addition to language classes, we offer a variety of programs such as Citizenship Prep, TASC (high school equivalency), and beginner ESOL conversation. We look forward to expanding our outreach and positively impacting a greater portion of our city's immigrant community. For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/
10019.title: Administrative and General Office Assistant Volunteer

10019.description: It is difficult and sometimes impossible for seniors to travel by themselves to necessary appointments such as doctors and dentist appointments, and on necessary errands such as food shopping. The Senior Escort program makes these crucial trips possible. Encore’s Senior Escort Program is a volunteer program designed to give much needed assistance and support to aging members of our community. Otherwise, due to physical frailty and disability, vision or hearing impairment, and cognitive problems, our senior neighbors are forced to cancel their trips - which leads to rapid decline in health and quality of life. Things to know: As a volunteer, you will meet the senior at their front door, accompany them to their appointment or errand, and then accompany them back to their home. Trips typically take 1-3 hours, depending on the circumstance. You will travel via public transportation (each individual is responsible for their own metro card) or via cab (the senior participant is responsible for cab fees) The clients we serve live in Manhattan south of 110th Duties include: Helping the older person dress in outerwear such as coat, sweater or hat for the trip Helping the older person lock and unlock his/her residence Helping the older person with physical strains such as assistance on stairs and carrying/pushing the grocery cart Requirements: Commitment of at least 6 months Weekly commitments, preferred Successful criminal background check & reference check Flexible hours Monday-Friday and/or available at least one day a week Attend program orientation & training Must be at least 18 years old Sensitive and empathic with the senior population *Important* Schedule: The program is not a fixed schedule. Requests come in every week, at different times and days Monday-Friday. Volunteers must have flexibility during the work week, i.e. a part-time job, or flexible work hours. It is required that you have at least one entire day free from Monday-Friday, we will place the volunteer on an on-call basis depending on the requests that come in that week. Your role as a volunteer in this program is incredibly valuable and rewarding. Senior program participants are so grateful for your time and help. It is a simple but vital service.
10019.title: URGENT NEED! Encore’s Shop & Escort Program. Accompany Seniors To Medical Appointments. Thank You!

10019.description: Estamos buscando un voluntario para acompañar a un encantador señor de 90+ años. Él vive en la parte sureste de la ciudad de New York. A él le encanta jugar domin ó , mirar noticias y novelas. Él te necesita solo una hora a la semana. GRACIAS. We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Necisitamos Voluntario Para Acompañar Encantador Caballero De 90 Años - Adora Jugar Dominó ¡Gracias!

10018.description: As climate change increases, one of the expected impacts is that temperatures in some areas will increase, and more generally extreme temperatures will become more likely. This is expected to put increased stress on the demand for heating and cooling - an aspect of energy production that has not gained the same traction as the large gains solar and wind have built in recent years. Global Green is a national environmental non-profit with offices in New Orleans, NYC, Los Angeles and NYC. We're seeking help from a researcher to evaluate market conditions, and best available technologies for renewable heating and cooling as a component of climate resiliency. Global Green is seeking 2-3 volunteers with a focus on: - policy and market conditions research - technology assessment and evaluation Each volunteer opportunity can be structured around the skills and interests of each volunteer while fitting within the larger overall research program. Additionally, we welcome research to be published as authored or co-authored content on Global Green's blog.
10018.title: Renewable thermal and Resiliency Research
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Unlocking Futures is seeking an experienced computer technician to help update our website with upcoming events, programs, pictures, and videos . Unlocking Futures is a non-profit volunteer driven organization committed to reducing the at-risk behavior of young people. Since 1985, Unlocking Futures has worked to deliver innovative and effective programs, aimed at empowering young people to lead fulfilled lives.
10018.title: Experienced Computer Technician

10018.description: DESCRIPTION The Trevor Project is dedicated to recruiting qualified volunteers to provide life-saving, life-affirming support to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and questioning (LGBTQ) youth. Our volunteers accomplish societal and individual change by creating safe spaces for LGBTQ youth in crisis and promoting awareness of Trevor’s resources. Trevor Lifeline volunteers are trained to answer calls on the Trevor Lifeline from young people who are feeling suicidal or need a safe, non-judgmental place to talk. This is an onsite volunteer opportunity and those interested need to live near our call centers which are located in LA. Time Commitment: **Note: Volunteers must be available for all training dates and times. Lifeline NY Updates July 2018 Lifeline Training: Orientation: Thursday, July 12th | 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM EST Training Dates: July 14-15th, 21-22nd (Sat/Sun) | 9:30 AM - 6:30 PM EST Post-Training: Thursday, August 23rd | 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM EST Trevor Lifeline Shift Times (we ask that volunteers commit to two 4-hour shifts per month): Sunday - Tuesday | 1:45pm - 6:00pm EST (New York) Wednesday - Thursday | 5:45pm - 10:00pm EST (New York) Friday - Saturday | 1:45pm - 6:00pm EST (New York) Required Skills and Qualifications: You are open to constantly learning. You are good at practicing self-care. You fit the profile of an ideal Lifeline volunteer: Genuine Empathetic Non-judgmental Empowering HOW TO APPLY **Please note: You must be at least 18 years old to volunteer. If you are under 18, please consider our Trevor Youth Ambassador Council. For more information, visit our website on trevorproject.org or reach out to our Community Engagement Coordinator Ashley Choi at Ashley.Choi@thetrevorproject.org.
10018.title: Trevor Project NY Lifeline Volunteer

10018.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking two (2) efficient and detail-oriented Database Administrative Volunteers to join their team! Fiver;s Database Administrative Volunteers ill work with Fiver's Operations and Accounting Department i a fast-paced work environment. Responsibilities for this position include but or not limited to, recording important information about the participants who attended and will attend Camp Fiver, Fiver's Summer Residential Program. This information is crucial when evaluating the success of Camp Fiver, evaluating and seeking funding, scheduling of Camp Programs, and maintaining pertinent contact information about Fiver Families. Fiver's Database Administrative Volunteers will assist Fiver in making a positive impact on the lives of youth throughout New York City and Central New York by successfully fulfilling the responsibilities of the volunteer position. Responsibilities include: Review Camp Fiver 2018 Applications and Health Forms Enter and update information collected from Fiver's 2018 Camp Applications Check for accuracy regarding addresses, Program Stages and assigned Session for each participant Conduct outreach for outstanding documents Any additional tasks related to this position as assigned Requirements for this position: Detail oriented Self-starter who can execute assignments independently A strong work ethic and sets high standards for his/her/their own work Strong organizational skills Analytical skills Experience with data entry and Excel preferred Language Skills Required: Spanish speaking preferred, but not required Fiver's Administrative Volunteers will: Attend a training on the software that will be used throughout the volunteer position Play a crucial role in a nonprofit that makes a 10-year commitment to youth throughout New York City and central New York and empowers them to make ethical and healthy life choices, become engaged citizens, and succeed in school, careers, and life. Be a member of a vibrant and divers team of staff members and volunteers Develop professionally through this volunteer position Assist Fiver Children's Foundation with the organization of information regarding Fiver participants who attended and will be attending Camp Fiver this summer Time Commitment: Must be able to commit a minimum of 10 - 15 hours on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday Dates: May 2018 - August 2018 If you are interested in this volunteer opportunity, please email your resume to casie@fiver.org.
10018.title: Database Administrative Volunteer

10018.description: Every Seed Planted Helps a Flower Grow! As a Seed Coach you will form a one-to-one advising relationship with a young woman of color to transform her passion and dreams into a powerful story for her resume and college essay. Seeds of Fortune, Inc. executive and Seed Coach team is a dynamic community of young professional women on a mission to provide creative and academic guidance, support, and opportunities for the next generation. Seed Coaches for the 2017-18 program will be provided 3 H.S scholars to work with throughout the summer and fall. TO QUALIFY AS A SEED COACH, YOU ARE: Equipped with at least two years of professional experience and great writing skills Ready to commit to Attendance at Boot Camp Digital once a week bi-weekly one-to-one writing and college sessions (Sept-Nov) Monthly in-person SEED workshops (Sept-Dec), and other special events Prepared to maintain clear and frequent communication with Seeds of Fortune, Inc.’s Program staff and your Scholar Eager to share in our mission to empower the next generation of women of color ​ AS A SEED COACH, YOU CAN EXPECT:​ To become an essential part of a young girl finding her voice Training and ongoing guidance as you build her college application Frequent communication with compassionate and knowledgeable staff and experienced volunteers An opportunity to grow with a dynamic community, and team retreat
10018.title: Seed Coach

10013.description: For many new immigrants, learning English is a first step to full participation in American society. Help them take that first step by becoming a volunteer teacher in English or Citizenship classes. English classes help students improve their communication skills. Citizenship classes help students prepare for the U.S. citizenship test. Volunteers work in teams to plan lessons and teach the class. This fun and rewarding experience gives you a chance to make a difference in the lives of others. Individuals with an interest in education careers are encouraged to apply. Requirements Must have good communication skills and a strong desire to help and work with new immigrants Prior teaching experience is preferred. Bilingual skills are a plus. We prefer volunteers who can commit to teaching at least two semesters Prospective volunteers must complete application and be interviewed. Volunteer Schedule: 9:30 am-11:30am (Tues or Thurs) 10:30 am-12:30 pm (Tues or Thurs) 1pm to 4pm (Saturday) 6:30pm to 8:30 pm (Mon, Tues or Wed) Spring 2018 - February 27, 2018 to June 7, 2018 Summer 2018 - July 9, 2018 to August 18, 2018 Prospective volunteers must complete application and will be interviewed. Please contact us at cpanyc@cpanyc.org for an application OR apply on-line here: http://bit.ly/volunteerteacherapplication For more information: http://bit.ly/VolunteerToTeachEnglishorCitizenshipClass

10013.description: VOLUNTEER NEEDED FOR OUR MANHATTAN OFFICE INSIDE OF FEDCAP. DUTIES: --Greet the client --Explain that we take pictures and they have to sign a waiver [(we can cut their heads off on the picture, should they not want to be seen) Not mandatory for receiving services] --Measure assist them in tying a tie (if they do not know how) finding a suit, shirt, slacks, shoes, etc. that fits. (They can try on the clothing in the restroom.) --Arrange for the hemming of pants or the sewing on of buttons with the tailor and set a date for the client to pick up the tailored items. If no alterations are needed, then fold up the items and place in a bag for the client. --Keep records of activities and calls in the log. --Be able to work alone, with minimal supervision or with others We are doing one day a week, for now (date to be discussed), but the time will be 10 AM to 3 PM. This is a great opportunity for anyone wanting to go into law enforcement and who wants to see \"the other side\" after a person comes home, someone that wants to be in the fashion industry, or social services/non-profit sector. You will be networking with everyday people, politicians, individuals from different programs (formerly incarcerated individuals, etc.), City organizations/programs, and pastors. There is a possibility that you will be helping with administrative work and our events as well. You must be neat and presentable. We also will need you to assist in pop-up shops and the occasional donation pick up. Check out what we do to get a better feel for 100 Suits http://www.100suits.org/100-suits-speaks Please be reliable! SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY!!!
10013.title: Fashion and Justice Volunteer (Queens)

11231.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. Responsibilities: Assisting the PR Coordinator or Director with any work towards the organization. Creating templates, emails, documents, etc for the Director/Coordinator. Reaching out on social media, posting pictures, hashtagging, tweeting, posting on Facebook etc. The ability to communicate properly and professionally with other volunteers/interns and prospective sponsors, donors. Overall Responsibilities: -Assisting Director/Coordinator with any emails, research, postings for social media. -Creating documents for the department potentially sharing this information with everyone. -Thinking of new and creative ideas for social media. -Reaching out whether on Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram, Twitter, to donors/sponsors etc. -Understanding email etiquette. -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. -Familiarizing themselves with social media, magazine, brochures. -Working with Wordpress, C++, etc for social media. -Creating templates for the PR Department. Competencies: -Knowledge of all social media -Ability to learn and consistently change with the organization. -Computer based knowledge. -Knowledge of Google. -Knowledge of Microsoft Office .
11231.title: Public Relations Assistant

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of several committee members to join our team of NF Walk Organizers! The role of the committee member may be: To partner with and support the event chair in planning the event within the community. Help motivate, recruit and retain the participants. Communicate with the event Chair on a regular basis and be proactive in the community promoting the event. Assist with logistics and pre-event planning. Securing donations for a raffle, picnic and fundraising. Recruit and organize event-day volunteers. Assist with event-day activity planning and management and post event wrap up. Join the CTF Volunteer Team and see what a difference one person can make! Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
10011.title: New York Charity Walk Committee Members Needed - NYC

10011.description: GRANT WRITER The Grant Writer is primarily responsible for developing and writing grant proposals to foundations and other grant-making organizations, and will persuasively communicate CSP's mission and programs to potential funders. Reporting to the Executive Director, the Grant Writer will assemble and submit grant requests, establish and maintain personal contact and relationships with foundation contacts, conduct prospect research, and maintain a calendar of submissions and other deadlines. To get a response please send RESUME.

10011.description: Education Program Coordinator - Chelsea Sculpture Park. New York , New York. Basic Requirements: BA or MA in related discipline required (Art Education) Post college professional work experience required Demonstrated experience with art education or other informal art programming and curriculum design Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft computer programs and excellent presentation skills Job Responsibilities: Coordinate and develop of new partner-institution/organization relationships and curriculum Provide leadership and direction towards the design and implementation of art educational programming and curriculum in compliance with national and state learning objectives, accreditation guidelines, and innovative art methodologies Establish and grow professional relationships with constituents, peers, associations and partner schools To Apply: Please submit your resume with cover letter and references to the contact information listed below. Set against the backdrop of the Hudson River, Chelsea Sculpture Park will offer fine art for the public to experience, up close and outdoors. The park's mission is to provide an aesthetic oasis in the Chelsea Cove section of Hudson River Park located between 22nd and 26th Streets, just steps away from the world-class Chelsea Art District. We are looking for a Education Program Coordinator to assist the founder and executive-director of Chelsea Sculpture Park develop and implement an educational program foccusing on the exhibitions of the sculpture park.
10011.title: Educational Program - Coordinator

10011.description: Chelsea Sculpture Park New York, New York Are you considering a future in arts administration, nonprofit management, fundraising, arts education or a related field? This is a great opportunity to gain experience working at a brand new nonprofit arts organization that is dedicated to building a sculpture park on the banks of the Hudson River Park. Gain invaluable insights and learn fundraising strategies as part of a dynamic Development team. Assist with prospect research, special events, direct mail, and our donor database, as well as pursue special projects. Internship credit may be arranged through your academic program. The ideal candidate will be organized and detail-oriented, and have good computer skills. Those with prospect research experience and graduate students in arts administration and arts education are especially welcome. The hours for this position are flexible within the work week. A modest stipend is available. To Apply: Please be sure to include current contact information so that we may arrange an interview. To get a response please send RESUME .
10011.title: Development Intern

In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of an event chair to lead our organizational committee! Position Summary: Serve as the Lead Event Organizer, overseeing the event from beginning to end. Organize/recruit, motivate and lead a committee of other volunteers as they recruit teams, obtain sponsorship, and plan the event details. Roles and Responsibilities Work with Operations Chair and Staff Partner to follow all Children’s Tumor Foundation policies and procedures as well as state laws and local ordinances as well as the program standards. Know and be able to articulate the CTF mission, vision and messaging points. Recruit volunteer committee leads to manage the various aspects of the event (such as: Media & Publicity, Logistics, Operations, Recruitment, Event Volunteers). Work with Staff Partner to schedule committee meeting dates, develop agendas and facilitate committee meetings. Monitor progress of committee chairs through regular communication to ensure tasks are completed. Enforce accountability with committee members for assigned tasks and the overall event goals. Adhere to pre-approved budget through work with Staff Partner. Assist with identification of the appropriate person to succeed you as Chair. Arrange for appropriate recognition of sub-committee members and event day volunteers. Preferred Skills and Experience: Previous fundraising event organization is preferred but not essential. Organizational skills including general organizing, planning, time management, scheduling, coordinating resources and meeting deadlines. Comfort speaking in front of a group or potential sponsor Excellent communication skills Ability or experience overseeing the work of others. Spreadsheet and/or Google Drive knowledge and experience is a plus. Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860

10017.description: The New York City Poetry Festival invites poetry organizations and collectives of all shapes and sizes to bring their unique formats, aesthetics, and personalities to the festival grounds, which are ringed with a collection of beautiful Victorian houses and tucked beneath the wide, green canopies of dozens of century old trees. By uniting the largest community of poets in the country and offering a unique setting for literary activity, the New York City Poetry Festival electrifies arts and literature and brings poetry to new light in the public eye. Our volunteer opportunities include but are not limited to: customer service and hospitality, stage management, entry assistance, tech assistance, bartending and food service, photography and videography, etc. This event takes place on July 28th and 29th from 11am to 6pm on Governors Island in New York City.
10017.title: Volunteer at the 2018 New York City Poetry Festival

The Event Chair engages community members to serve in subcommittee roles while developing and implementing a successful annual community event to raise funds and awareness of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. 10017.title: St. Jude Walk/Run to End Childhood Cancer - Event Chair (Jersey Shore, NJ)

10016.description: Thanks so much for wanting to make a difference. We are recruiting volunteers to be group facilitators for children ages 5-17 (groups are divided according to age), as well as event and fundraising helpers. Please view below for the volunteer type requirements and descriptions. The family and children group sessions are held at two Manhattan school locations, midtown and harlem. I invite you to visit our website at www.acaringhand.org to learn more about us and to acquire an application: https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/ea9db3_572250eb6e1d4899bd0837d204ffdbe9.pdf. Feel free to contact me directly at RobinGoodman@acaringhand.org for more information or to send A Caring Hand application. View our video about our group program directly at https://vimeo.com/90184263 or on our website, acaringhand.org VOLUNTEER TYPES AND REQUIREMENTS 1) GROUP FACILITATORS: Group facilators must complete an application, have an interview, and attend a 8-12 hour training. One year commitment is required to co-facilitate the child and teen groups. 11 wee group session is held 3 times per year, summer, fall and winter ( Sept - June). A monthly drop in session is held Sept-June. Attendance at a 11 week session is a minimum requirement. In certain circumstances, a commitment for the monthly groups can be accommodated. Group facilitators are assigned to weekly groups during the weekdays and evenings. The days when groups are held vary from season to season. Currently groups are held on Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and our monthly groups are held on Thursdays. Indicate your best evening availability during the week. Groups are held at two Manhattan school locations, midtown and Harlem. 2) VOLUNTEER EVENT HELP: We rely on the generous donations from individuals, corporations, and grants to fund our work. We need a strong volunteer event committe to help with all aspects of our annual gala and other fundraising activities. 3) VOLUNTEER HELPER AND FUNDRAISING: We always need extra hand on deck for various short term projects throughout the year. The projects range from stuffing envelopes and answering phones to doing outreach in th community. Certainly if you have a particular skill aor specific time you would like to help out you should let us know. We also rely on volunteers to help with A Caring Hand, The Billy Esposito Foundation fundraising activities and other board projects. WE WELCOME VOLUNTEERS WITH A RANGE OF EXPERIENCE! APPLY TODAY! Follow this direct link: https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/ea9db3_572250eb6e1d4899bd0837d204ffdbe9.pdf or visit our website at www.acaringhand.org for an application.
10016.title: Volunteer Group Facilitators and Event Help Needed!

11568.description: We are in need of a panel of Industry experts in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering Arts, Math (STEAM) to inspire, motivate, educate students to enter these fields. You will be part of a panel of five or six people speaking about your career and how it relates to STEAM. Students will then be able to ask questions of you. You will need to commit your afternoon from 2:45pm- 4:00pm if selected. Panels will focus on themes throughout the week. With the following format: Monday - Science Tuesday - Technology Wednesday - Engineering Thursday - Arts Friday - Math All panelists must schedule a 30 minute interview with our volunteer management team prior to being accepted as a speaker for the program.
11568.title: CreatingSTEAM Panel Speakers

11568.description: We are looking for a competent volunteer, should be able to motivate and inspire. You must possess organizational skills and ability to communicate with students from diverse backgrounds and experience. The goal is to ensure that our organization is always staffed with the best and most reliable individuals, and that they are correctly positioned for the fulfillment of our program and their interest. Time Commitment Before Event: 2 hrs During Event: 40 hrs After Event: 5 Hrs Duties and responsibilities Before Event Sign MOU for copy right and media responsibilities Understand program logistics and role During Event Take pictures Take Videos Upload pictures to designated organization location Pick the best pictures for the final video Help create final video Perform social media posts through program After Event Create video of the event to be posted on YouTube channel and social media Post all images in our image library online **There may be other assignments that we would need to fill in accordance to your availability, skills, and interest. Qualifications Know how to use a professional digital camera (Nikon) Basic knowledge of any video editing program and/or website People skills Understanding of group dynamics Extra: Owns a camera Know a second language that is not English Working conditions Working with students at the upper middle school and high school level. Start Date July 16, 2018
11568.title: Media Assistants Wanted for CreatingSTEAM Program

11568.description: College Students attend our programs as mentors/coaches and facilitators of the learning experience for our students. During our CreatingSTEAM program, college student mentors are assigned to student groups to assist them in navigating the projects and meeting their deadlines, acting as both a guide and a facilitator through the process. If you would like more information about our mentoring program, please contact us at info@we-connect-the-dots.org
11568.title: College Students Wanted as Mentors for CreatingSTEAM Program

11568.description: CreatingSTEAM is a 10 day experiential learning program where students gain competencies in 21st century workforce skills and awareness of STEAM career opportunities for today and in the future. Teacher volunteers and students are involved in designing and teaching the sessions or co-teaching with STEAM industry experts. As a volunteer, you will help and mentor students by being interactive and supportive during the program when the students need help. You will have the opportunity to learn along the students and inspire them to be life-long learners. Other duties might include registration, setting up and cleaning up before and after the program as needed. Do I need to have technology skills to volunteer? No, technology skills are not required, but certainly are a plus if you have them. Either way you will learn through participating with the students. The most important skill or requirement is the desire to help students learn and motivate them to be successful. You will come away with new and valuable technology skills. Our program incorporates a variety of team building activities that support our goal to engage students to work collaboratively. The result is that by volunteering you will benefit from the experience and come away with valuable skills. To learn more about the opportunity at this link: http://we-connect-the-dots.org/creatingsteam/

11735.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
